reviewText:
Whatever people were freaking out about regarding the PC port originally, it seems to be long since fixed.

The real problem now is that the PC port has been dropped altogether by the publisher and they swept it under the rug like nobody would notice.

This means:
- No Improved Netcode
- No Kombat Pack 2 (Leatherface, Bo'Rai Cho, Triborg, Xenomorph)
- No New Stages
- No Mortal Kombat XL bundle

They have been avoiding answering us since the announcement of Kombat Pack 2 to quell this outrage, and they are still igoring the entire community as to a justification for why. This is especially frustrating as they went to great lengths to fix the PC version.

I am done with NetherRealm Studios and WB Games.

reviewText: As of 20 January 2016, NetherRealm Studios has officially ended support for Mortal Kombat X on PC. From Kombat Pack 2 forward, no balance patches, netcode patches, or new characters will be coming to this version of the game.\n\nDo not buy this version of the game. The studio has no desire to support the PC as a platform, and they do not deserve your money.

reviewText: Mortal Kombat is one of those franchises I will always cherish.  That being said, the pricing model of this game is atrocious.  There are decisions I agree with - for example, offering to allow players to spend money to unlock all Krypt items.  Not everyone enjoys unlocking.  The biggest ones I disagree with are the way the characters are sold.  It's almost like the game wants to be a F2P with microtransactions, except that it's not F2P because you have to drop $60 to get in the door.  The Kombat Pack kind of sort of is like a Season Pass, except it isn't because it leaves out Goro.  So you've gotta drop your $60 for the game, another $30 for the Kombat Pack, and on top of that you also have to buy Goro.  I'm assuming that if they release any more characters, you'll have to buy them as well.  Unacceptable business practice in my opinion.  Either make the game free to play and then nickle and dime players for specific content, or put a price sticker on all of the content that we pay up front and then give us the content.  For this reason, I am going to have to say not recommending this game.  It's a shame too, because it's otherwise a fantastic game.  But I refuse to support this kind of greed.

reviewText:
This is probably the only thoughtful rant you'll ever see from me as I usually don't care for this stuff, but this game is a different case. For starters, let me tell you that I love this game to death (would rank it with the best games of the year); love it's style, combat, everything from a presentation standpoint is top notch in my opinion.
And that is coming from a person who hasn't been that keen on MK or any fighters beforehand, also a person who stood beside the game when it didn't work day 1.
As you can see, I have like 90 hours on it, which isn't too shabby for me, aswell as like 97% of achievements if I complete the story mode. All of this love towards the game and NRS/WB changes as of today because they think they can get away with slapping me right in the face (MKX on PC will not be getting future DLC support and improved online),  they think us PC fans of the game aren't worth the tiny bit of effort it takes to port over DLC to this platform, which is insane in my opinion, it's not that much work.
Combine that with the stone cold attitude from NRS to this makes me really feel blindsided, so yeah, screw this game, and screw future WB/NRS games if they recieve such poor treatment.

reviewText:
Worst Port Ever! (Now the second worst port following Batman: Arkham Knight, which is also a game published by Warner Bros.  What a lovely coincedence!)

This review is a negative one. But I should say this first, the game is great.  BUT NOT THE PC VERSION!

I can never recommend this game in it's current state.
I don't even know where to begin;

* Performance issues since release date.  Frame drops, memory leaks, crashes weird CPU usage etc. Online lags / disconnects a lot.
* Each update is a mess.  One of them, which is about 14 gb (patches this big for a fighting game...seriously?) deleted most players'  save files.  They made people download another 14gb patch afterwards just to fix that. Real pros I can say...  Did it improve performance? Not at all...
* The latest surprise is the GAME DELETES ITSELF RANDOMLY and tries to reinstall the entire game (which is over 20 gb).
You quit steam before it finishes? - it loops back to beginning
You wait till it downloads? -  it loops back to beginning.

The latest issue made the game completely unplayable for me.

Out of my 100+ steam purchases this is the only one I consider a waste of money.

Special thanks to everyone who's responsible for porting this game to PC platform.

Stay away from the PC version of MKX.

reviewText: Purchased this and the season pass day one in hopes that the game would be solid and supported all the way through. reviewText:
FOREWORD: DONT BUY MKX on PC. ED BOON SCREWED US UP. Why? Read below.

Ok, now. I am a Bulgarian guy, living in Germany. I waited for a good while for MKX to pop up on 3rd party software companies like bundles, cause steam dooesn't let the Germas buy it, and I finally procured it. So in my good old review fashion, we get to pick the good and the bad. And as of 22.01.16, I will take a look at the terrible before the good.

THE TERRIBLE:

Why the hell aren't we getting the extra packs on PC? What did we do to you, Ed Boon? Aren't our money just as good as the people who bought it on consoles? WHAT GIVES?!

The Good:
1. Better character skins. Let's face it, MK9 was a muscle/breast overkill.
2. Great costumes. I loved them.
3. The arenas ware awesome.
4. The characters are cannon. Even if we introduce the new gen  (Cassie, Jacqui, Takeda & Kung Jin), we see a ton of characters doing cameos from the mk1-9 series.
5. The story is good. I disagree that the story could have been better. I loved the story and it kept me on edge.
6. SO many MK3-9 characters do cameos in this game, be it Kombatable or not. Fujin, Tanya (now playable(, Baraka, Rain, Sareena, Mei Li, the Quan Chi undead Striker - Kabal Army (to elaborate: Smoke, Striker, Kung Lao, Liu Kang, Kitana, Sindel, etc.)?
7. Variations provide a breath of fresh air to caracters without changing them much. I like that addition, albeit there are variations that beat others.
8. The Krypt is back from MK9. It is  a game in itself, unless you bought all crypt items DLC.
9. Everything that MK9 had to offer is in MKX. Don'et ever get this wrong.
10. The tough bosses are back from MK9 - Corrupted Shinnok spamming his OP attack FTW, Just like Shao Kahn and his spear/hammer.
11. MP with factions and kills and an ongoing battle.
12. I have always considered the MK franchise to be the more honorable and the more mature one than Street FIghter 4-5, Dead or Alive 5, etc., with its ature approach to audience through fatalities, brutalities, babalities (not in MKX) and so on.
13. MP feels good and works good,... When IT WORKS GOOOD!!!
14. Single Player MKX works well. You get new stuff every day, new towers every day, new challenges every day. Kudos.
15. I mean it - the game does just as good as it does bad. It is purely subjective. Read through and decide for yourselves.
16. There are regular patches that relieve the bugs or inbalances that plague the game. That is a good thing,
17. Towers that refresh every day in comparison the the long running ones.

And for me, it ends there. For a PC user that is. And now comes the bad:

First and foremost: DLC DLC DLC... WHat the hell ppl? Why turn the only fighting game with no dlc into an DLC paradise??? What's next? Bikini Sonya, Kitana, Mileena, D`Vorah, Tanya?
1. Skins must have been into the game, like MK9. MKX seems like a downgrade in that respect.  This pertains to 2, as I dearly miss my Skarlet. I bought the hole package on my trip to... (cry)... why!!! It was a good vacation! I know I cant buy MK9 in Germany!!! You maniacs!!! YOu blew it up!!! Damn YOU!!!
2. DLCs plague the game unlike MK9. NO Goro, Tanya, Predator, Tremor, Jason Voorhees, etc.unless you pay up. Good job ppl.
3. Cross platform MP is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. I played like 20 matches, and 8 of them were laggy. LIke 6 FPS laggy.
4. I played 20 matches and 90% of those were vs enemies of skill 50+ vs a new player that starts the game. A newbie dies immediately to them. I won a few with Cassie and took a few rounds off the big guys, to my pleasure. I loved that, and I dont regret my losses. THat felt GOOD. So it might add to the good batch of experiences, right?
5. I had tons of cross-pc and cross-platform lag. Stilll. I had battles that ran at 5 frames per second - weirdly enough, I enjoyed those, because, after round 1, I knew that I can slow mo my attacks, and be on par with a 65 skill guy. I still lost though. 65 vs 24 beginner? You do the math.
6. The whole faction stuff feels half bait. I know I would soon switch to the Black Dragon because they win and I want my stuff because I bought the game!!!
7. Lag in online games is still there.
8. Get GOOD" is an issue. Yes you need to get good. Or you lose.
9. Where is my 300 challenge tower? Why is it changed to daily towers that do the same thing over and over again?
10. If you are a casual player
date:
the game peters off way too quickly into the "let it be played into the tournament circle". MK9 is still better in that respect.
11. The variaions are subpar. Better ones still beat poorer ones.
12... Now hold on to your knickers if you have a short fuse.
- unless you "get good" you will lose 90% of the time.
- unless you learn the new quirks
recommended: you will lose 90% of the time\n- the online  player vs player is unfair
voteText:
lvl 1's vs level 80's. because nobody else is there.
- ergo you may be completely new and be forced to fight a veteran who strings combos for ♥♥♥♥♥ and giggles.
13. On purpose - the community is not there at all. Way too few people do MKX anymore.
14. OH wait

in isn't there anymore. Unless you pay!

reviewText:
From launch till this very day.
The game itself has gotten better with its patches; mostly through optimization. Sadly, this game is not worth your time on PC if you ever plan on purchasing it. At launch this game was pretty terrible, and with a major patch it wiped a lot of saved data - meaning you had to restart all over again. A select few were given a token to unlock everything, but really it should've been offered to everyone before a certain date of purchasing the game.

Months later (or practically a year) the PC customers were abandonned by the developers, and will not be getting anymore content. NetherRealm and Warner Bros. have now been boycotted by myself and a few rightfully angry consumers.

The experience I've had with Mortal Kombat X as a game.
Despite the negative review, this game is really fun! I really enjoyed the campaign and I certainly enjoyed the multiplayer aspect. At launch it wasn't really running very well, but I've handled worse with my laptop years ago. After the major patch that wiped my save data I was really, really upset with the developers, but I gave them the benefit of the doubt after venting my anger towards them through emails, tweets, and Facebook messages to demand a token to unlock all the kyrpt items. After every major update I had comeback to test out the game. Overtime, the game finally became better optimized enough for my PC to handle it at 60 FPS (regardless if I exceeded Recommended specs), and I considered coming back into the game.

I'll be happy to play the game every once in a while, but I certainly will NEVER recommend this game to a single person who plays on PC. You can buy it on Xbox One or PS4, but as the developers abandonned this game I refuse to give this game a recommendation.

How can this game be redeemed?
Simple, the developers should continue support.

reviewText:
Update 6/30/2015

After a patch or two later and playing more I have had a successful online experience, finished story mode, and now I have a few extra things to mention.  The memory leak seems" fixed for the moment and the game appears to be much more stable.

+ I only did a couple of online bouts and the experience was surprisingly smooth compared to initial release.

+ Living Towers offer a good alternative to the classic arcade tower with a ton of modifiers and challenges along the way.  It still feels a little tedious after a few
date:
but definitely an improvement on the idea.

+ Being able to overlay combos / specials / finishers on the screen while you fight was extermely helpful at times especially in story mode when you are switching characters every few fights.

-  Between mobile and console/PC versions the developer makes too many attempts to reach into my wallet.  It is extremely tacky and distracts from the game.  The focus that was placed on this should have been spent on making the game a better experience
recommended:
but that would've cost money instead of made it so what motivation did they have.  On day one this was a $30 game at best considering how much money would be made on DLC / microtransactions.  Develeoper greed is definitely out of control at the cost of quality making us quite literally pay more for less.

-  Loss of tag modes... why?  It was so much fun and when I could actually convince someone to play with me locally it kept their interest longer since they could essentially test out two characters in a single match.

-  No stage fatalities which have been a staple of the series throughout and a few of the backgrounds seemed well suited for a good set up.

-  Too few background stages that become repetitive and worn out quickly.

- Story mode

reviewText:
Never had a game that I both loved and hated so much before. The game itself is great, but the port is awful. The story is better than MK9, and the overall gameplay feels much smoother. Also, the new Living Towers are a blast to play and really add longetivity to the game. However, this game is plagued with bugs for many people. Some people with great PCs cannot run it, and there are many people who can't get into an online match (myself included).

As fun as this game is, I would wait a month or two for all of the bugs to get patched out.

Pros: Nice Graphics, Improved Story Over MK9, Smooth Gameplay, Living Towers are Amazing!!, You can find a character for nearly every playstyle, Krypt is very fun to explore

Cons: Lots of bugs which are both small and large, Online is nearly impossible to play for many people, They charge $5 for Goro even though he is already in the base game, People are having trouble running the game at 60 FPS

Overall, as fun as the game is I cannot recommend it. It might look like the pros outweigh the cons, but this review would not sound nearly as happy if I had paid full price for the game. I recommend waiting a few months for the bugs to be patched out, and then getting the game (possibly during the Summer Sale).

Game Itself: 9/10
PC Port: 4/10

reviewText:
First of all, this game is awesome. It's filled with content, has plenty of fanservice, and is a pretty deep and enjoyable fighting game overall. But something has to be said about the way WB is handling this game and its fans on PC.

WB just announced that they would be ending support for the PC version of Mortal Kombat X. The upcoming DLC characters will not be released, so if you bought this game hoping you'd have the complete experience on your PC, well, you're outta luck. First Arkham Knight's abysmal PC port, now this. The technical flaws and the crappier netcode of this version were bad enough, but they managed to disappoint us even more with this news.

WB Games is shaping up to be worse than EA at this point, and as someone who had this game on PS4 but sold it because PC is my platform of choice and I got this version on sale, I feel completely cheated. This is almost as bad as Dead or Alive 5's port.

Don't buy this game for PC. Don't give them a cent of your hard-earned money. If you absolutely want to play MKX, buy it on console. Preferably used so that you don't have to support WB in doing so.

reviewText:
The game itself is great, in the nutshell: awesome graphics, lots of improvements, brutalities, more violent, interesting story, superior characters and much much more great stuff. At this moment I do not recommend this position, for now PC port is horrible, crash after crash. Few fights, CRASH to the desktop, again few fights sometimes not even one fight and.... CRASH. Bought this on the sale, If you are a huge fan of Mortal Kombat and you like performing Fatality on your PC, then this title is for you in any other case I recommend Mortal Kombat Komplete Edition (it is also not the best PC port but for sure it's more stable than X).

Edit: 2015-10-07
After so many crashes, I have enough, PC version is a big pile of unplayable ♥♥♥♥. I made that mistake and I bought this, seriously don't waste your money.

reviewText:
I would wait for a patch.

I use a r9 295x2, and play @1440p. Within two hours of playing the game I will max out 4096MB Vram, then the game uses up my 1GB SSD page file, and starts eating on my 32GB DDR4 system Ram. I use multiple monitoring tools to check reource usage, and this is a very problem, and on a very high end machine. I played 6 hours @1440P last night and the game was consuming 4GB VRAM, plus 26 GB system Ram!! After restarting the game is was OK. The game runs brilliantly, at a constant 60FPS, and completely fluid all the way until the eventual windows warning that you're running out of ram.

In this current state the PC version of the game is like a ticking bomb that can crash at any moment after the first couple hours based on resolution, and vram usage. I wouldn't buy this game until the problem is fixed, especially if you have a lower end system, or run higher than 1440P.

reviewText:
I had some fun with this game, when playing with a friend. I put aside all the flaws, gave it a chance, enjoyed the good parts. But now, I am completely ♥♥♥♥ed off, and will not be buying from Warner Bros ever again.

For a $60 game, it is broken and not worth it. It is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ console port with horrible FPS at times. It controls horribly for PC. The matchmaking doesn't work, and if you do get in to a match it will time out or fail to connect, or have extreme lag. But the thing that really made me snap, was that Warner Bros aren't even releasing the second Kombat Pack for PC! After paying $5 for friggin' Predator, I expected a Xenomorph to fight with as well!

Warner Bros are a horrific company who need to be held accountable for their cheap ♥♥♥♥♥♥ PC ports, their lousy business standards, and cash-grab attempts. In my opinion they are the worst of the worst, because unlike EA or Ubisoft, THEY MAKE EXCUSES FOR THEIR ♥♥♥♥♥♥ BROKEN GAMES. They purposefully exclude a huge section of the market for their own selfish benefit. They fail to fix games, even months after release, focusing on paid DLC instead of patches.

Warner Bros, I will never purchase another game from you again. You have ♥♥♥♥ed up one too many times, with Batman and now this (let alone the various other games you've ruined). All I wanted was my own Alien vs Predator match, and you've ruined that for me to cater to the console kid gamers.

reviewText:
The game has been out for almost three weeks at the time of this review. 5/4/2015. Jason will be released early tomorrow for Kombat Pack owners, just as a reference for when this was written. My PC can overkill this game, all performance problems are from the game itself being EXTREMELY poorly optimized.

Edit[5/17/2015]: PS4 has a new patch and PC of course, does not. Xbox One does not either, but it was confirmed to be coming in a day or two. PC however, must wait. How long? They didn't say. They never say. They never acknowledge that the PC version exists.

Edit[5/28/2015]: We still don't have the patch. There has been no word on when it's coming, and both NRS and HVS has refused to keep us updated. We know nothing. We don't know when it'll come, if it'll come with Tanya's release, and we don't even know when they're releasing the future DLC characters because they don't keep their word on deadlines. ♥♥♥♥ this piece of ♥♥♥♥.

Edit[5/30/2015]: AS OF TODAY APPARENTLY EVERY TIME YOU CLOSE STEAM IT UNINSTALLS MKX AND TRIES TO REINSTALL. WHAT THE ♥♥♥♥. WHAT. THE. ♥♥♥♥. ♥♥♥♥ this game. ♥♥♥♥ High Voltage Studios. Do not buy anything that has their stench on it.

THE BAD
- The netcode(or netkode, get it?) is truly awful. I've never had a match that I felt was just fine or even remotely free from lag. It doesn't suffer from this as much as a game like Street Fighter, but it still sucks.

- The game randomly crashes online, sometimes ranked or player matches will flat out crash my video drivers and after troubleshooting and getting several different versions of them, I can safely say it's not the drivers. Alright, let's say it doesn't crash. It takes several minutes to find a match sometimes, it's clearly broken. There are not that little players playing. Okay okay, it finally gets a match after 5 minutes of waiting in queue. Mid-game you can get an error that says The game session is no longer available" and it boots you out. Then sometimes you can't even enter rooms because the chat server is down. Great!

- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g0kOekwEqLE

- It fails to fully record my online stats. It says I have like 20 fatalities
date: but 0 wins online? Really? How is that even possible? I even have the 10 ranked match wins in a row achievement on steam.\n\n- It has random FPS drops/performance issues. I've never actually been able to replicate it
recommended:
but it'll just drop from 60 fps to 45 or 30 for a while and it's never consistent. I've only noticed that it happens more often than not on the stages with snow/rain falling. It fixes itself when it goes into an x-ray which is really weird. It happens offline in training mode too.

- Steam Cloud has been erasing people's saved games.

- People have been having insane memory leak problems.

- Some Faction options are disabled randomly for some reason
hoursPlayed: I still have no idea what causes this as I've tried it logged into my WBID and without
voteText: it just works whenever the ♥♥♥♥ it wants to.\n\n- Somewhat imbalanced character quality wise. Bojutsu Kung Jin has so many mix-up options
helpfulPercent:
while Shinnok is in the toilet.

THE GOOD
- Graphics look great when it's at 60fps
votesHelpful:
the stages look awesome. I like the Jinsei Chamber.

- Story mode is 3-ish hours with optional QTEs and nigh seamless transitions to fights. It's not as long as MK9 but it's still very cool.

- Zoning is much weaker than the past game
votesTotal: mostly with the addition of running/stamina. Running also adds depth to combos.\n\n- The newcomers are very cool and unique
votesFunny: while some of the returning cast get very good looking redesigns.\n\n- Variations potentially triple the entire roster. Some 100% change the character into something new
commentsCount: while others are just small preferential changes. Unfortunately

some aren't good at all. Why wouldn't you pick Thundergod Raiden over Displacer?

- Extensive training mode options.

- Frame data in the game(whether it's all 100% accurate is unknown but it's mostly correct.)

- Fatalities are as gory as ever.

- WHEN THE GAME ACTUALLY WORKS LIKE IT'S SUPPOSED TO

IT'S FUN.

The Verdict
It's okay. If there were a neutral option I would pick it here. When it works

reviewText:
The absolute worst pc port I have ever played.
The game has potential, I have been a loyal mk fan since the beginning, me and my friend even bought the actual arcade cabnets starting with mk 2 through 4 when they were released. I have always placed mk on a pedestal along with many other gamers, this is my absolute favorite fighting game.

mk has seen better days and deserves a quality port.  My computer is fine, I can normally run 2d fighting games at 4k and have them be at least 30 fps.  I am currently playing gta5 maxed out and at 45 to 60 fps, in fact the only games I can't play maxed out and near 60 fps are unoptimized ports. This is the absolute worst.  Anyone with a half decent pc should be able to run a 2d fighter and hit 30 fps, not so here.  I am only getting 5 more frames per second playing at 1080p than at 4k.  I get maybe 25 fps at 4k and maybe 30 at 1080p, even so the game is so choppy and stuttering.  One forest level is completely pixelated.  This is after the 15gb update, truly unacceptable.  Ed Boon said in an interview I listened to that the pc port would be great when he was asked please tell us the pc port will be good"  Was there no quality control over the company that was hired to port this???

my system is I5 quad at 3.0
hoursPlayed: and overclocked 3gb vam msi / amd 7950 freeze.  This setup although getting old kicks ♥♥♥ with new and old games

reviewText:
Fun fighting game. But there is a catch... Great sound design, graphics and gameplay appropriate for both try-hard and casual fighters. The different fighters has distinctive differences and feel cool to play as. Horribly bad-good  story in the campaign.
Launched with severe pc-port problems, but they were fixed and the game is playable at this date. Some graphical artifacts occurs, but it's not harming the experience very much.

NetherRealm Studios and WB Games ended DLC and patch support for pc way too early. PC-players do not get any more content, fixes or optimizations. The anticipated Kombat Pack 2 became console exclusive. To top it off, this was communicated in the most embarrassing silence I've ever experienced from a publisher.

Publisher and developer does not deserve your money on this platform. Dumping a whole community in the way that they did, was ridiculously unprofessional. MKX is a cool game, but not something to buy for PC. If you want this game, buy it for your PS4 or XBOX ONE.
But give it a thought.  Do publishers, who act unserious and prematurely end port-support even deserve your money?

reviewText:
I cannot recommend this at all. It's a shame cause as a fighting game it's possibly one of the best. The gameplay feels excellent, like you're doing some serious damage to your opponent, the brutalities, x-rays and finishers are excellent but as a  whole it feels unfinished and NetherRealm is spoon-feeding you extra content for a price. This game has other issues aside from this, but this is my BIGGEST problem. Let's break this down.

As of this review there are 5 pieces of DLC.

Kombat Pack: £24.99. 4 new characters (not including Goro), includes a themed skin pack for each, includes Samurai pack.

Unlock all Krypt Items: £14.99. Unlock every item in the krypt (skins, moves, concept art, badges etc), rather than spending Kombat Koins earned by playing the game or through microtransactions.

Samurai Pack: £2.79. 3 new samurai-themed skins.

Blue Steel Sub-Zero: £1.59. Sub-Zero skin

Goro: £3.99. Goro is playable, you unlock him if you preordered it also.

Mobile App: £Free. Free mobile app to unlock skins that can only be unlocked via mobile. App isn't accessible in most regions including United Kingdom.

This is insanity. Kombat pack is fine but overpriced, Unlock everything in the krypt is insulting, Samurai/Sub-Zero skin whatever, Goro was an incentive to pre-order the game.

Other issues include the game being poorly optimised, it used to dip below 40fps in most stages but that's been fixed, hardly any game modes, not that many characters to choose from, not many stages. Without a doubt there will be a komplete edition" with all the DLC bundled
date: you're paying full price for half a game

recommended: go for it. If you're looking for a stable online experience...this is probably not it."

reviewText:
I would reccommend this game, but the developers have abandoned the PC port, meaning:
No Kombat Pack 2
No fixed netcode
No Mortal Kombat XLBoth PS4 & Xbox One are getting the newer content. The Mortal Kombat franchise is one of the first I remember playing & it's very disheartening to hear that they've left us out in the cold. This is purely speculation, but I believe this occurred because Warner Brothers cut ties with High Voltage Studios after the disasters with several game launches on PC, including MKX. Even if this isn't the case, it still would have been nice to hear it from NetherRealm in a video when they announced Kombat Pack 2 instead of making fans play the guessing game for a while before making a forum post on TestYourMight. Honestly, I'm more upset that they were not upfront about the situation than I am about the lack of content. I just hope that NetherRealm will release the same content for all systems when the next Mortal Kombat game rolls around. Until then, sayonara~

reviewText: Well, seems it's finally happened. Not only were pc users shafted with a sub par pc port that was almost completely broken on release, and not only did we have to wait up to WEEKS to get the most recent patches, and not only have they never fixed the netplay for pc, i've just learned that pc support for this game is being cut entirely. http://testyourmight.com/threads/future-of-mkx-on-pc.58181/page-7#post-1999319\n\nThis is a classic example of how not to develop for the pc platform, and some of the worst port atrocities we have seen this year have come from WB Games. This is unacceptable in this day and age to treat pc gaming like a red headed step child, and there is no excuse for it. I highly recommend you avoid not only this game, but ALL WB Games in the future until they stop treating pc as an afterthought. reviewText:
Most of the initial problems the game had were fixed the only thing they really needed to fix was the online and some other small bugs that don't affect the actual gameplay, in fact comparing to the launch, the game is pretty good right now and there's lots of content.

But the reason I'm not recommeding is due to the devs and publishers recently announcing the game will no longer be supported, which means there will be no further patching, no further DLC (Such as Kombat Pack 2), no further extras and no improved netcode which as of the time I'm writing this will soon start to be tested on consoles. This is quite shameful and disrespectful towards their consumers, made all the more embarrasing since this is not only a good game but it could have been fixed and supported in which if they played their cards right it would bring more people into playing it.

Long story short, this game has been abandoned and will remain incomplete compared to the console versions.

reviewText:
Updated review as of May 7th:

I have downloaded 60 GB of patches for this 30 GB game, one of which completely wiped my save data. Awful optimization issues remain. The netcode is still bad, possibly even worse than it was pre-patch. Hitconfirming online is impossible. Video freezes and crashes are still happening despite the patch notes promising to eliminate them. I tried an online match last night and the video froze in the first 3 seconds of the round, forcing me to hard reboot my computer (windows key+d, ctrl+alt+delete and alt+tab don't work). The game doesn't close properly and remains in the task manager when exiting.

This port is not just amateur, it's woefully incompetent. I won't be buying another HVS/NRS/WB game again.

reviewText:
Day 1 DLC and microtransactions on a $60 game.  Why did I buy this?  A decade ago, publishers would have called this an extended playable demo and it would be free.  And if you liked it, you'd pay full price for the rest of the game.

People would have fun mastering the special end moves.  People would learn the characters by playing through with each of them to unlock different characters and suits. . . . . Now, instead, you're supposed to just pay extra for anything.

Why are people supporting these tactics?

reviewText:
Absolutely broken PC port.

There's an option in the game that sets the resolution to 2560 x 1080 which is supposed to be 21:9 yet selecting that option seems to do absolutely nothing. It's forever stuck on some weird windowed border with the sides cut off. Toggling the window border option doesn't help either. Also the game doesn't seem to recognize a difference between Full Screen and Windows mode. Half the settings do absolutely nothing.

The frame drops dip below to the single digits for whatever reason in the Krypt.

Oh, and the Premium Edition doesn't include all the DLC. Goro is still missing along with some skins and they're trying to pass off some 20 dollar unlock everything in the Krypt DLC...

Can't recommend. Not even on sale; unless you really really really really REALLY like mortal kombat... I got the Premium Edition of this game on sale for 12 bucks and I STILL FEEL ROBBED.

Doesn't seem to be getting the Arkham Knight treatment where they actually try to fix the game. They're just going to leave it in this sad state. Do not support.

reviewText:
I would have left this game a positive review as of a few days ago, despite the atrocious handling of DLC. I got it on sale and was satisfied with what I got for the price. Now apparently Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment has decided to drop the game altogether and I'm left with a game whose online community is going to instantly dry up. So instead of being able to enjoy my game, I should have bought it on a console where there would at least be a chance of playing with my friends.

I will not be buying any future products from Warner. NetherRealm may not have had a say in this, but I can't say that for sure. If it turns out they're part of this, I won't be buying anything from them either in the future. If you can't trust the future viability of a product, why buy it? This isn't just blind rage, it's just that, unfortunately, the most important thing for a fighting game of this type is the community, especially one that focuses so heavily on the online experience as this one does. The game itself is stellar, and the port (despite a very rocky beginning) was patched up to perform quite well. That product is still as strong as it was from that aspect, but the lack of future support will kill the community that formed around it on the PC. And that's a shame.

Get out of the PC market, Warner. Your track record is abysmal.

reviewText:
This was it. My game. Countless hours i've put in this. Not a single day has gone by that I haven't thought of this game. I've recommended this game to many friends, and they all bought it to play together. And a few weeks ago, my supposed dream came true. Kombat Pack 2 with FOUR MORE characters including my favourite horror character Leatherface, Bo' Rai Cho and of course Sektor. I was so hyped by the first trailer i didn't sleep that night. And few days ago they announced the online enhanced, with something that i wanted since release: improved netcode!
And now i just discovered that they won't be releasing this on pc.
I forgave them the horrible launch, i forgave them the crappy netcode. But this? Aren't you supposed to fix what you broke? Isn't it the right thing to do to keep supporting your game? If you want to drop pc support, do it with your next game, but don't split the fanbase in half and force the people that already bought it on pc to buy it again on ps4 or xbone.
You really dissappoint me.

Several years later our neighbour got PS 1 and MK 4 on it (he also have other games, but MK 4 is all what I remember). I spend a lot playing that one on his console (at his home or he brought his console sometimes to my house and we played some sort of tournament between our street friends). Since 2009 I heard a rumours about MK Komplete and was happy when it finally get in PC. Without a doubt I buy 2 copies of the game for me and my brother. reviewText:
Summary: Easy to learn, graphically fantastic, terrible online experience.

Update 2: Over a month since my initial purchase on release. It's rare that a day goes by without steam trying to download between 500mb & 10gb of patches for this game. What it's patching I have no idea & I am certainly beyond caring. What a terrible release.

Update: Since the latest 15gig patch I can confirm that the online now runs at 60fps.
However, I have had repeated trouble connecting online matches with wait times over 2 minutes & have repeatedly seen King Of The Hill matches drop mid-fight. Leaderboards are still not reporting correctly & search parameters to find good connections are still non existant.

-----

Mortal Kombat X is a great looking game & compared to other titles in the fighting game genre, relatively easy to learn with forgiving controls & few mechanical systems to learn.

While MKX doesn't have as strong a story as MK9, due to the extensive cinematic presentation, the story mode is far better presented than most other games of this genre. However, short of farming the game's inbuilt unlockable currency 'koins' to acquire additional costumes & concept art you probably wouldn't want to play it through more than the once. Completion of the story mode will average you around 5 hours max.

As with all fighting games, the meat of the product is with the competitive VS mode.

Locally as with the story mode detailed above, it runs at 60 FPS, looks amazing on max settings & as such the only lag for your input depends on your monitor or television's refresh setting & your system itself. Online is a whole different story & ultimately where the game (in its present state) suffers a real 'fatality'.

As with MK9 before it & the PC release of both SFIV & KoF, the netcode is spotty at best, outright broken at its worst.

The frame rate drops down to a locked 30fps for online matches, making all the combos & control inputs you learn locally in practice & story mode, completely worthless. Added to that an omni-present lag both in the character select menus & the combat itself & finally an inability to be able to search by parameters for ideal connections & you have an unenjoyable mess of a product. It's also worth pointing out that at the present time, even if you do can connect (or find) a ranked match, that the leaderboards for this mode are also completely broken.

If you plan to take this game seriously at a FGC competitive level, you'd be best served getting the PS4 version as it's undoubtedly what will be used by organisers at tournaments anyway! Reports also state that the net-code on that system is comparatively problem free as it was developed in house by Netherrealm themselves, unlike this outsourced, seemingly second class PC version.

Negatives aside regarding the online, If you just want to see where Mortal Kombat has come in the last 20+ years, there's a large variation of single player endurance & challenge modes & a trouble free experience of playing friends locally. Showing off all the outrageously gruesome fatalaties is likely to provide half an hour of entertainment during a game night at the least.

It stands to reason, that when the most important component of a fighting game is in such a sorry & broken state, that I can't recommened the product.

reviewText:
Can't recommend this to anyone before this game receives some major optimizations. I have fairly high end computer (i7 4570K, 16 GB DDR3 and two R9 290X's in Crossfire-X), and I'm still getting very noticeable lag in visuals and input even at medium settings @ 1080p.

Not only that, but the game refuses to launch if I change my TV to be the primary monitor. Just get the splash screen and nothing after that. To get the game to launch on TV, I have to do the following:

1. Set my PC monitor as the primary monitor
2. Launch the game
3. Set the game to windowed mode
4. Make TV the primary monitor
5. Put the game back to fullscreen mode

Simply put, it's the worst PC port I've seen in quite some time. Wouldn't waste my money on it again.

reviewText:
Mortal Kombat X is the 10th installment in the iconic Mortal Kombat series, and probably the best game out of them all. It features 26 playable characters (35 if you include all the DLC) with each characters having 3 different variations that are designed to fulfill specific roles (zoning, trapping, rushdown and so on). The variations provide changes in terms of moves and combos, so in reality you're looking at a game with potentially 105 characters (DLC included), which is a lot. The characters are well balanced for the most part, which means whichever character you choose to main will probably also be tournament viable if you get good enough at the game.

The game is also very fast paced for a fighting game, and offers players tons of content, from a (good, but short) story mode; to traditional towers in which the player has to beat a series of AI opponents with a final boss at the top; to living towers (regular towers that get updated with new challenges every once in a while to mix things up) and more casual game modes such as test your might and test your luck. It also features a return of the Krypt, in which you can unlock various costumes, fatalities and other behind the scenes novelties.

This port had a rocky start when it first launched on PC, with people not being able to get past the main menu due to its many issues, but most of the issues it had are now fixed. All in all, the game continues Netherealm Studios' tradition of offering the player great value for money by showering him with tons of quality content - a lot more than what you'll find in any other fighting game out there.

So why am I not recommending this?

As of January 20th, Netherealm had announced that they are dropping support for Mortal Kombat X on the PC. This means that the Kombat Pack 2 DLC, featuring Triborg, Bo Rai Cho, Leatherface and Xenomorph, will not be released on PC at all. This also means that PC users will not get the updated netcode that is currently being developed for the console users, and will have to stick to the inferior (and quite horrible) netcode the game currently has. On top of all that, every new balance patch the game receives from now on will not make it to the PC. In sum, anyone who plays this game on PC is doomed to play an inferior and different game than the console version. You'll have less characters, worse online, and worst of all - the frame data on your moves list will not be compatible to the frame data of your console counterparts, which means that any effort of friendly competitive play between a PC user and a console user will automatically put the PC user at a disadvantage (if you had plans to play this game competitively in casual tournamens like I had, you might as well forget about it).

Now lets be clear: while I do hold Netherealm Studios responsible for this to some extent, in my book the main villain of this is Warner Brothers, who now demonstrate a pattern of releasing shoddy game ports on PC (Batman: Arkham Knight, anyone?) followed by quickly dropping support for said ports. That company proves time and time again that it doesn't care about PC consumers by outsourcing games to bad port developers and quickly dropping support for said ports in favor of making new DLC. This is quite embarrassing for the company, as it turns away from the few people still willing to give it money for its horrible PC releases.

If you're a fan of Mortal Kombat, consider buying it on console as it is indeed a good game. If you're strictly a PC user, however, don't bother. You'll be playing an inferior product that will be vastly different from the main game. Also, in the future, if you encounter a Warners Brothers game that is being ported to the PC - avoid it like the plague. I know I will.

reviewText:
First off if I had the option this would have been a sideways thumb but for now I'll give it a thumbs down.

Really fun game but right now it feels like a bad port. If you have friends to play it with it might be worth getting it right now but if you don't I would hold off for either an update or price drop.

Current Issues my friends and I have ran into:

Crash to desktop on leaving multiplayer matches sometimes, normally happens when we want to switch up who in the group we are playing against.
Game will lock up sometime without actually locking up, it's almost as if it got stuck in some loop where by the game is responding but you can't actually do anything. Normally this is accompanied by a loading screen for online play
Getting into a private match online is kind of hit or miss sometimes. I've had times where a friend invites me and after accepting it won't put me in the match and instead pulls him a random opponent despite the fact they chose private match.
To build on the last point this happens more often in Towers and King of the Hill. We'll setup a private match and all of a sudden random person we didn't invite gets in
Some of us are getting really bad frame drops on certain levels and that can generally be fixed by messing with settings but you have to go and edit a file to change some of them. If the setting actually exists for editing it should be editable in game. Honestly that just comes across as lazy, I'm not going to sit here and say that would be an easy thing to add because I have no idea what their code looks like but I was really hoping that would turn up in a patch by now.
Faction related stuff is hit or miss sometimes it's up sometimes it's down
Bad match making, when we play against each other the latency is not an issue at all because we live in the same state but it seems when we do match making the game doesn't take into account the latency as well as it should
Gameplay wise the game is great and I highly recommend it if you are a fighting game fan but if you happen to have a PS4 or Xbox One perhaps consider getting it on there instead.

reviewText:
Mortal Kombat X, easily one of the best games so far to come out in 2015, and has me very hopeful for the future of the year. However, the port of the game to PC is once again a disappointment so far, and until some things are fixed, like the performance, frame rate drops, not being able to play decent matches online without disconnecting, random crashes,, not being able to do anything with the faction system because you can never connect to the faction server, a patch that is 15GB for about 5 fixes, all problems that are all almost non existant on consoles. I recommend staying far away from the PC port of this game and just go get it on console, because the game is amazing and a must have, but the port on PC is so far dreadful. I'm willing to forgive you NRS if you fix some of this crap.

In summary, I would recommend the PC port of this game to anyone who:
-only has a PC to play on and doesn't have either XB1 or PS4
-has a high-end, expensive computer that can run the game
-is willing to put up with a bunch of BS and work to get the game working, changing settings, looking up guides on how to get it to work, and willign to put up with all the above problems ^.

If any of those are you, all the power to you, get this game and enjoy. If none of these are you, i would recommend just getting it on console, cause this is a disaster.

reviewText: When purchasing something, there is a belief that the consumer is buying a fully functional product. This however was not the case with Mortal Kombat X. Upon launch, as I am sure you are well aware, the PC port was prone to a wildly inconsistent frame rate, unpredictable crashes, data wipes and, an unusable netcode for online play among other issues. I resisted the urge to immediately demand a refund as I had fallen to the sunk cost fallacy (having bought the game and the kombat pack) as well as having faith in Netherealm's announcement that they would fix the game. Fast forward a few weeks, the game received two massive patches in one day. The first one crashed the game and wiped user's local save data. The second one was implemented to fix the first patch. Neither of these two patches fixed the other problems the game had. Netherrealm made numerous promises to their consumers to fix the game. It took nearly 6 months to finally have a stable build of the game for offline play. The netcode was still abysmal and the community was nearly dead. Fast forward to today, I learned that not only will PC users not have access to the new characters coming out in the next few weeks but I will also not have access to the improved netcode that will be implimented in the future. As a fan of Netherrealm's games, I that instead of being rewarded for having faith in the company and their product, I feel as if I am being punished for not demanding refund sooner.

reviewText: When I heard that this game was being released on PC, I immediately become excited.  I used to be heavily into Mortal Kombat, but stopped following the series sometime around Deadly Alliance.  The idea of getting back into the series seemed nostalgic and awesome.  I pre-ordered and anxiously awaited for it to be released.  I even upgraded my set up to the recommended specs to fully enjoy it.  When the game arrived, it was clearly not optimized for the PC.  There is a constant framerate stutter no matter what settings it is on.  There's also horrible online play that occasionally just refuses to work and won't connect to games.  Also, some features advertised for the console versions are just straight up missing in this.  It's clear the developers and the company responsible for the port just don't care about the PC community.  It's been three weeks since release, and these issues haven't been solved or even addressed in a satisfactory way.  I give up.  I'm uninstalling and not supporting these companies ever again.  It should be illegal to straight up sell a product that doesn't work as advertised and not be able to get a refund for it.  You'll see many reviews telling you that it indeed works on other people's computers.  And indeed it does.  It's random.  No one in the forums can figure out why it works for some and not for others.  So if you really want to play Mortal Kombat X on PC, you just have to ask yourself if the price is worth the coin toss.

reviewText: DO. NOT. BUY. THIS.\nIts not even a game. Its a constant headache and bandwidth bottomless pit. Even if Netherrealm Studios got off thier ♥♥♥ and fixed the constant updating bug, theyd just release a patch that deletes your gamesave. The game is horrendously ported. Runs way worse than MK9 by a long shot and has pathetic graphical optimization with unacceptable frame rate studdering. If you even try to connect to multiplayer you can expect to play the worst fighting game match up of your life. MK's community has taken a dark turn, compared to Street Fighter. At least the 30 different versions of street fighter IV work. I loved Mortal Kombat, but I think after this game, the series is finally dead. Netherrealm has a completely disrespectful, disregard for PC gaming and it has become apparent from them releasing such a broken title. Even Ubisoft addresses their game breaking bugs after a while. There is a noticable delay in between patches from the console versions; proving the consoles have priority over PC when it comes to updating the content. We also have experienced delays on every DLC so far with no apology as to why we had to endure such a horribly organized launch to the Jason DLC. Do yourself a favor and check both the community discussion and the lackluster announcements tab, to see the massive bug lists, broken gameplay and inexcusable amount of patching. This plays worse than any Early Access title I have ever played. I dont write a lot of negative reviews, but this is the LITERAL example of a bad port. Go with Blazblue or many of the other excellent fighting game ports, this one is a lost cause.

reviewText:
Okay while it lasted...Until that brick of sobering reality hits you upside the head.

MKX, the most recent install in the long line of the Mortal Kombat franchise, landed on the PC platform with a thud on April 13, 2015 (must be unlucky day).

Long story short, the game was plagued with horrendous amounts of issues since the first day, that those on the PC platform had to wait for the third-party porting developers to fix. Not until when a new set of third-party developers came in does the game finally shine.

If you're a fan of the series, you'll be plenty satisfied. Taking the lessons from the last Mortal Kombat game further, it's about a bone-snappingly appealing as is the gradually solidifying gameplay, that still has its own quirks. The story has a few surprises and is a visual feat, but does not have the crazy shocking moments that MK9 has.

However, Consumer be warned. As of this and PLENTY of reviews below will attest, this is now officially the legacy port of the game. It will not recieve the upgrade to MKXL nor the Kombat Pack 2 characters. As a result, caution should be thrown as to how badly you wish to play this game of the series if you do not own either an XBone or PS4. That means no upgrade for the netcode (despite it being rather unfixed and still atrocious, even after multiple patches towards it), no further balance patch fixes, no extra anything. This game made me regret buying anything from WB Games and NRS.

If anything else, and you still want a decent fighting game that will still get better support and already ran through beta tests showing that things will work for you and your system, get Street Fighter V instead.

TL;DR version - I do not recommend anyone getting this from this point on.

reviewText:
I never got into any Mortal Kombat games before and I decided this would be the one. Of the 5 or so hours I played I thoroughly enjoyed it and was looking forward to putting many hours into it. I was especially excited to hear about KP2 and the GGPO netcode fix coming only to discover today directly from NRS' mouth that they are dropping support for PC.

If this decision was based on WB's perceived notion that they wouldn't make a profit off the PC player base currently the irony is that fixing the netcode I'm sure would have brought back many players who in turn may have bought KP2 and any future DLC. I'm glad I only paid $15 for the game and that they didn't get any of that money. I will not buy any of WB or NRS games again. Vote with your wallet if you don't want this to happen again to the PC community.

EDIT: The more I play MKX the more I love it but I wonder if continually playing it and building my skills is worth it in a game that for a lack of a better metaphor, has effectively had it's throat cut and is slowly bleeding to death.

reviewText:
I have 45 hours logged, by no means does this reflect how I liked the game (WHEN IT WORKED)

From the jump

-Horrible port - I bought two copies... one for myself and one for my roommate. Our computer specs are near similiar but the only difference was he had a  GTX 970 vs my GTX 980. (HUH????)

- Online spotty - How many times did I join a online match only to be playing near 10 fps? I'll accept the fact that it was launched recently when I tried... but 4 months down the line? You can sure pump some DLC out but cannot get the PC up to par or the netcode?

I'm not good at reviews, but I felt like I got a unfinished game.. its cool I guess, a few patches and it be straight? WRONG!

Oh and they dropped support for the PC, enough said after that.

Pros? It was a **DECENT** fighting game....

-Playing against my brother who is less than 5KM away from me is laggy as balls.
+Krypt was the only innovative thing.

reviewText:
Netherrealm studios and Warner Bros do not care about PC players in the slightest, as shown by the horrendous launch and unplayable multiplayer for the longest time. When everyone else on consoles received patches and updates, PC players were left waiting until Netherealm finally remembered to include us. Now Netherrealm has announced the Kombat Pack 2, which includes new fighters such as Alien, Leatherface, Triborg, and Bo Rai Cho as well as a new level (a fan favorite, The Pit). Not only that, but they have also announced Mortal Kombat XL which includes all of the players (including the new ones), all of the skins, and the new level The Pit.

Exciting right? Except that Netherrealm announced these would be available only for the PS4 and Xbox One.

PC players, faithful fans, are left out of the fun. We don't get the new players, we don't get the new stage, we don't even get the new upgrade to multiplayer. We paid the same money that the console players did, but they get more than we do.

It's not fair, which is why I don't recommend anyone on PC purchases MKX anymore.

F*** you Netherrealm

reviewText:
Welp, after months of hard work on behalf of whoever got stuck with the job of fixing this game, it DID get (mostly) fixed. The only problem that remained was the netcode for the online multiplayer.

MK X will no longer be supported by the devlopers or the publisher on PC, and that multiplayer fix is going to consoles only. Not only that, but the future Kombat Pack 2 characters won't be coming to PC either, and neither will the XL version of MK X. All of that hard work for nothing.

I'll post my original positive review just so people can see what I thought of the game. Either way though, this game is soon going to be a drastically inferior version to the consoles, not in preformance, but in content. ♥♥♥♥ you Warner Brothers. If you have such little respect for your PC customers to abandon them like this, then please would you kindly get the ♥♥♥♥ off steam.

----

Original positive review-

Ah MK X. Never before have I felt so guilty for loving a game. I've spent somewhere around £80 on this game despite everything.

The port is still jank. Running my 970 I still get stutters on the charater select screen and during the intros/outros to each fight. The netcode is... Well, it's classic High Voltage netcode. It would seem at this point (months after launch) that WB have pulled the classic Batman Arkham Origins on us and decided that we need DLC charaters and skins before a fully functioning game. If you can get this on console instead, do it.

However I never rarely go online (I suck and I find it stressfull) and I can overlook the preformance issues (Which in honesty for me are kinda minor) because I love MK X. In spite of everything. The fighting is better than ever, the roster is strong with not only a large range of charaters, but three variants for each, mixing up their already detailed mechanics for a completely (most of the time) different play styles. The story mode is good yet short, nearly half of what we got with MK 9, weaker but still a fun expereince in that department.

You're going to have to decide whether you can put up with the ♥♥♥♥ that is the PC version of this game to play it for yourself. I reccomend it purely off of my experince of the game alone. I'm just a bored anonymous guy writing into a box afterall. All I can say for certain is to NOT go near if you do not have a higher end of graphics card, or if you are looking for a good online experience.

reviewText:
Since Warner is treating us like garbage, I feel like their games don't even deserve a full review, so I'll just write a short summary:

The PC port, now that it was fixed a bit, runs quite well, even on my 3 years old PC. Looks great, runs at 60 FPS (but the fatalities, X-rays and cutscenes are locked at 30 FPS) and sounds great. As for the game, it's a very good MK. Not as good as 9, IMHO, but it's very fun, has a polished gameplay and a very interesting story mode.

HOWEVER...

There's still one major problem with the PC port: the Netcode. For most people, the game is a PAIN to play online. Too laggy and unstable to be enjoyable. And the worst part: it seems like support for the PC port has been dropped by the publisher, and they don't even have the RESPECT to issue an official statement on WHY they dropped it.

The new netcode that the console versions are getting is NOT planned for this PC version. In fact, a NetherRealm employer even stated in a forum that the new (and enhanced) version of MKX is planned FOR CONSOLES ONLY. We won't get the Kombat Pack 2 that was promised, we won't get the new stages, nothing!

They are avoiding the PC community like a plague. They don't answer our questions, don't issue official statements, and don't even CARE about fixing the remaining issues (like gameplay balance!).

After things like abandoning Gauntlet in a flawed state, releasing Batman: AK in THAT unplayable state, and what they are doing with us, I am done with WB Games. ¬¬

reviewText: Support for this game is officially over only console versions will experience the next wave of DLC.\nWarner Brothers have officially given up on PC Mortal Kombat X after a horrific launch on their two biggest games of 2015.\nDo not pre-order or buy any Warner Brothers game on PC straight after launch as their credibility with PC performance is destroyed.
voteText: 13 of 13 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I don't usually write reviews, but this one's deserved. Anyone wondering if they should get MKX on PC... The answer is NO.

Why? We got this game on release with a LOT of issues. While not as bad as Arkham Knight's sorry state, Warner Bros decided to green-light the game. Lot of performance inconsistencies, unplayable stages (I'm looking at YOU, Sky Temple), lack of options on release.

After months trying to fix up the game, though, they've decided to pull the plug, call it even, and not continue supporting the PC playerbase. What does this mean for you, possible new costumer?

-No improved Network for the PC version.
-No new characters (no Alien, Tri-borg, Bo-Rai-Cho or Leatherface)
-No new skins
-No new stages
-No Mortal Kombat XL bundle, which would have included all DLC available plus all of the above

And most important yet:
-No further fixes for issues that still remain (unplayable stages still unplayable), performance hiccups just because.

Be also warned, that WB Games has had two strikes already (first this, then Arkham Knight) so beware in the future, costumer.

Avoid this sorry excuse of a game/PC port.
voteText: 13 of 13 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I was willing to defend this game up until now. The port was bad but it was slowly being fixed. The character roster was smaller than MK9 but the characters were really fun and interesting. The DLC was expensive but at least we got some really cool additions to the roster. The micro-transactions sucked but they weren't forced on you that much. Most important of all, the game was a lot of fun.

But now they've completely betrayed everyone who bought this game on PC All future content for this game is not coming to the PC version. That means no new characters, no new stages, no new skins and people who played competitively on this version are now at a permanent disadvantage compared to people who bought it on console.

This game is now officialy abandonware and I feel completely betrayed. I suffered through this mess for a long time and now they just gave up on us. The terrible launch was an omen for what was to come...

If you still decide to purchase this game, you are supporting everything that is wrong with the current gaming industry

reviewText:
Mortal Kombat X Review
I'm an old school MK fan. I was around at day 1. I used to steal quarters from my parents change jar, then ride my BMX bike to Circle K and dump those stolen quarters into the “original” jamma board cabinet. OK, I'm old we've established that! Moving forward to the pros & cons of MKX.

Pros.
Great single player campaign mode
Graphics, and audio effects are good
Full controller / fightsticks work perfectly
Couch buddy matches are fantastic
Cons.
The Steam version match making is horrid
If your lucky enough to find a match, the lag is unbearable.
NetherRealm didn't even develop the PC version (outsourced to High Voltage)
No PC support for online issues (No patch or fix for us, sorry)
Incomplete roster on PC (No Alien Vs Predator for us, sorry)
The worst part was I thought WB was behind this blunder. Turns out it was Ed Boon, and NetherRealm Studios.

Links:
PC not getting Patch / Full Roster
Warner Bros admits NetherRealm bailed on PC
Petition to NetherRealm Studios [www.change.org]

Visit our Currator Page

reviewText:
Welp! After the cough up at launch I must say this is the best Mortal Kombat up to date. The graphics are amazing. The gameplay is amazing and overall just brilliant all round. They’ve removed some characters from MK9 that I liked but brought some new ones in that are pretty good too.

Gameplay
The gameplay is good. The fighting is amazing and all the characters have three different fight styles. After playing as each character I must say it’s very well balanced. Although some characters I think are harder to use than others. Oh and last thing… them fatalities…damn.

Graphics
The characters and the arenas are brilliant and are very unique. The blood, sweat and mud/sand/snow (depending on the arena) all mix together in the middle of the fight making it really gritty. Oh and again… the fatalities…wow.

Story
The story carries on from MK9 and for Mortal Kombat it's very good. You see a lot of characters from MK9 that you can't play as in 10 so that sucks a bit, but I must say, I did enjoy the story and I really got in to it.

Overall I think this is an excellent fighting game and currently my favourite followed by MK9. I do wish there will be more skins for the characters in the future. But for now this game is still one of the best games that has been released this year in my opinion.

reviewText:
I have been withholding writing reviews of MKX, because of my immense patience, love for the series and hopes that this newest instalment of the game will improve given enough time. I pre-ordered it (never will do it again with any game by any publisher. Thanks for teaching me this lesson WB), I suffered first days where game was missing almost all the content. The only saving grace was that HVS, although clumsily, was trying to repair things. Rumour has it they got fired (thank gods if true!), and after several months game was brought to what we have today:
- pretty graphics
- fluent off-line play
- nice story mode
- several new features like living towers and premium towers
- generally pretty enjoyable experience
- Sub-Zero ;)

♥♥♥♥♥♥ online was always NRS's mark, so I was not really surprised it is ♥♥♥♥♥♥ again in MKX.

Why the negative review then?

Because after game on PC was patched to the very satisfactory level, after an announcement has been made, that ♥♥♥♥♥♥ online will no longer be ♥♥♥♥♥♥, will have GGPO-like beta to improve it, after announcing another Kombat Pack (yeah, I got the KP1, too, silly me), we have been informed PC gamers will get none of this, implying the support for PC version has ended.

If you buy this game now, you will be stuck with game that lacks new content which console version will soon have (4 new characters, new stage(es), new reskins if anybody cares for them. Also - most likely and most importantly - new balance changes and improved online. This is why review cannot be anything else then negative. It breaks my heart, even so that after tiresome patching the future of this game on PC wasn't looking bad.

If things change, this rating may also change. If NRS provides some justification for treating MKX PC like it never existed, other then: we won't support MKX PC course in result of our not-giving-sht-about-pc-port player base on PC just moved away from our game.  For now, if you are not a hard core MK fan, avoid this game at any costs.

reviewText:
Would have recommended in the past, now I can only recommend you abandon the idea of touching this game or any NRS/WB game that exists or may come to exist. They don't give a ♥♥♥♥ about their customers as evidenced by their actions, and as such don't deserve any to begin with. When (more like IF) they start respecting their fans as a whole across all platforms, as is deserved, then maybe it could be considered a better idea to buy their games.
The sad part is that lots of people like me bought the premium edition, which is by no means cheap, and most people would think that doing so would allow them some sort of special rights when it comes to DLC, usually in the form of a discount or early play. That way, eventually everyone will still get to play it. Dropping it completely is not only a foolish choice as a developer, but unfair on the whole community plus those that went the extra mile to be cut short.

TL;DR ♥♥♥♥ you NRS, and ♥♥♥♥ you WB. Greedy scumbags. If I could get this refunded, I would, and would recommend everyone else did too. Keep treating people like this and you're going to lose a lot more than one platform of consumers.

reviewText:
After the announcement of no more PC support I had give this game a thumbs down and add my 2c.

On the surface, it looked like a good game. And it is a good game; probably the best Mortal Kombat to date.

However after a while you realise it's a below average port from a console generation, with hopeless netcode that makes online play virtually impossible (if you can even find a game), greedy money grabbing micro transactions, expensive DLC which should have been in the game in the first place and now to top it off, no more content or support for PC players.

Completely unacceptable way to treat your loyal customers and fans.

Will not buy another Mortal Kombat or Warner Bros game again.

reviewText:
On launch this game ran well for me and I didn't have any problems.  This was mostly because I played offline due to me not really enjoying fighting games without the person being right beside me to bicker and banter with.  So I don't really have a complaint about the port being bad at launch, it's unacceptable to have a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ port on any platform however.  My main problem is what everyone else has with this game now, the fact that WB/Netherrealm stopped supporting the game.  They announced a Season 2 of DLC characters and that was exciting, they announced Netcode updates for online which made people happy, and then they turn around and say that the PC will no longer be supported.  There was no real announcement of why they would stop supporting the PC.  If there was some explanation of why this was and not an excuse like lack of resources maybe this outlash about this game almost a year later wouldn't be as prominent.

In this day and age where we have the so called console wars we see more and more developers turn away from one platform or company to support one of the other.  This is twice now that a bad PC port has been delivered through Warner Brothers, the other being Arkham Knight.  I don't see why some companies seem to snuff off PC gaming and deliver sub-par or not deliver a product at all.

Does this mean this game isn't good?  No, as a matter of fact I liked and still like this game.  I will ocassionaly hop on when I have people over and play.  This game is fun, but if it is no longer going to get newer and better features it is not worth it.  I have minor gripes and groans about this game such as lack of certain characters and certain characters being in the game in general but those don't deter from this being a good game.  I would advise not buying this game unless things change.  Don't support companies snuffing off platforms or abandoning not even a year old game.

reviewText: Here's some context, if I was merely reviewing the quality of the game running as it is supposed to (AKA the console version), I would be hard pressed to not recomned this for MK fans, unfortunately its not as easy as all that... I love MK, grew up with it, & I was livid with the great return of its 2009 reboot, even have the kick ♥♥♥ bookend collectors edition for PS3 & the classic arcade stick. So here I was, blowing 80$ for a game & season pass for another go to one of my favorite franchises, knowing my PC should rock it at 60 frames & I'd be sure to love it... With that said, boy was I so ♥♥♥♥ing wrong. It should be known now Wanerbrothers buissness practices for many of its PC ports is vile, & needs to be known. After putting up with the botched preload launch, awful porting with lists of techincal/ performance issiues, patiently waiting for oversized patch downloads to not even completly fix the game... Of course when I heard of the Xl netcode update with kombat pack 2, I was hopeful PC port would finally get touched up properly with the new wave of DLC to get it on par with the other versions...Now WB's & NR are taking our money & running, completly dropping future update support & DLC for the PC version... They didn't even respect the fans enough to outright publically accounce the drop of support or offer some kind of compensation, but instead have us come to that displeasure on our own findings leaving us with this broken game empty handed... Unacceptable. There are far better optimized & supported fighters on Steam, personally looking forward to Killer Instict's cross play PC port myself. So do yourself a favor (Assuming this game doesn't get picked back up & fixed) avoid it at all costs, sale or no sale, do not give them your money.

reviewText: I love Mortal Kombat. This game included. But this ♥♥♥♥ is unacceptable. Don't waste your money on this game. Not at full price. Buy it at a discount, if you must.  The PC version of this game will not be receiving any future support, and Mortal Kombat XL as well as Kombat Pack 2 will not make it's way to PC\n\nBasically the story goes that Netherealm Studios or WB, maybe, outsourced the PC port to seemingly inexperienced developers High Voltage Software. On release this game was ♥♥♥♥♥ed up with performance issues, connection problems, pretty much every red flag of a garbage port job. MKX had received a decent amount of support, patches rolling out to address performance issues, and game balance. And then nothing. Regular support stopped in September, albeit with a fairly substantial patch. Now fast forward to January 2016, Netherealm is releasing tasty little tidbits of information about Kombat Pack 2, and now Mortal Kombat XL, which is pretty much the GOTY edition of the game. And then Netherealm responds to a tweet from a fan confirming the exclusion of MKXL and Kombat Pack 2 on PC. There's no explanation yet. And I doubt there's going to be one.

reviewText:
On launch this game ran well for me and I didn't have any problems.  This was mostly because I played offline due to me not really enjoying fighting games without the person being right beside me to bicker and banter with.  So I don't really have a complaint about the port being bad at launch, it's unacceptable to have a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ port on any platform however.  My main problem is what everyone else has with this game now, the fact that WB/Netherrealm stopped supporting the game.  They announced a Season 2 of DLC characters and that was exciting, they announced Netcode updates for online which made people happy, and then they turn around and say that the PC will no longer be supported.  There was no real announcement of why they would stop supporting the PC.  If there was some explanation of why this was and not an excuse like lack of resources maybe this outlash about this game almost a year later wouldn't be as prominent.

In this day and age where we have the so called console wars we see more and more developers turn away from one platform or company to support one of the other.  This is twice now that a bad PC port has been delivered through Warner Brothers, the other being Arkham Knight.  I don't see why some companies seem to snuff off PC gaming and deliver sub-par or not deliver a product at all.

Does this mean this game isn't good?  No, as a matter of fact I liked and still like this game.  I will ocassionaly hop on when I have people over and play.  This game is fun, but if it is no longer going to get newer and better features it is not worth it.  I have minor gripes and groans about this game such as lack of certain characters and certain characters being in the game in general but those don't deter from this being a good game.  I would advise not buying this game unless things change.  Don't support companies snuffing off platforms or abandoning not even a year old game.

reviewText:
Would have recommended in the past, now I can only recommend you abandon the idea of touching this game or any NRS/WB game that exists or may come to exist. They don't give a ♥♥♥♥ about their customers as evidenced by their actions, and as such don't deserve any to begin with. When (more like IF) they start respecting their fans as a whole across all platforms, as is deserved, then maybe it could be considered a better idea to buy their games.
The sad part is that lots of people like me bought the premium edition, which is by no means cheap, and most people would think that doing so would allow them some sort of special rights when it comes to DLC, usually in the form of a discount or early play. That way, eventually everyone will still get to play it. Dropping it completely is not only a foolish choice as a developer, but unfair on the whole community plus those that went the extra mile to be cut short.

TL;DR ♥♥♥♥ you NRS, and ♥♥♥♥ you WB. Greedy scumbags. If I could get this refunded, I would, and would recommend everyone else did too. Keep treating people like this and you're going to lose a lot more than one platform of consumers.
