reviewText:
I will be reviewing the game and the condition of the gameplay itself. I will be comparing some elements to mortal kombat 9 in this review.

Mortal kombat x is based on the new generation of fighters as well the original cast that were invovled in the tournment, to participate in protecting earth realm and stopping the brotherhood of shadows.

Story Mode:

-Good-

I liked how each of the characters in the story mode bounced off each other well. The plot was fonded interesting as the new characters made their appearance and showed what they are capable of.

-Bad-

Was slighty disappointed as the story left out a considerable amount of plot holes that casual players and even Mortal kombat fans could not understand. It also can be completed within a few hours of game time depending on your skills. Certain returning casts from Mortal kombat 9 are invovled in story mode but can not be used in the game. My favourite kombatant in the game is stryker, but what im complying to is, why put him in the story mode cast if hes not playable? Id rather him not appear in the story. Same goes to all kombatants. All thats doing is annoying Mortal kombat fans. For mortal kombat fans that played this mode would find each character levels confusing comparing to the MK9 story.

Gameplay:

-Good-

Very impressive as the mechanics of the game is flexiable. When choosing a character you can be able to choose 3 different play styles that go with it. That gives you enough playing time to invest on what character and style is best for you or mastering the physics of every character in the game itself. More than happy with how the game is trying to do something different through the mortal kombat series. Fresh, brand new game. The graphics and the fatalities in this game is the best so far from the series and the graphics are on point. The Krypt mode is amazing. A whole new adventre unlocking things in the game and getting jump scares while exploring. Impressed with the design of the mode.

-Bad-

Factions is beyond the most pointless thing they ever tried to put into the game. Why create this feature in the game if you can use any chracters that are apart of their own affiliation? For example Sonya Blade. Her background is based on special forces. Why can I use her in any faction if she is meant to be special forces? Pointless and ridiculous! Another silly thing about this game is the fact that they didnt even put a tag team mode in it. If factions are based on team work why isnt this been mode been put in the game? I was hyped for it when I heard about it before released date imagining you could use jax and sonya in tag mode on a special forces faction. Netherrealms created an achievement stating you have to jump teams and gain the right amount of experience. So how can some players be loyal to their factions if the achievements are made like this?

If you are an fan of the mk universe, you will find theirs limitations to most returning characters. Like raidens teleportations can be used only in one variations and sonya's military stance can also be used in one also.

-Condition-

On release date, this game turned into a tragedy as it was almost unplayable, but months later it got patched up. Worry no more on that side of things. This game is CPU hungry so I would suggest getting the reccomended chip for the game. The netcode is not the best of things as Ive noticed delays compared to online and singleplayer. Players will always have a problem with playing smooth matches with opponents online nevertheless. Its something we have to get used too.

-Conclusion-

Very fun game to play and it will last for sometime. Nice to see that netherrealm is doing something different with their franchise and moving on up with the next generation of gaming. If your an Mortal kombat fan thinking to buy this I reccomend buying this on sale as theirs going to be a lot of things that will p*ss you off like:

*DLC Hungry
*Returning characters in story mode not playable
*Plot holes in the story
*Faction being pointless
*limitation to some characters supermoves in each variation
*Bad netcode
*No tag

Metascore: 76/100
My Rating: 65/100
voteText: 28 of 41 people (68%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
(MKX Review)
This review is Based on the PC,xbox one and the ps4 versions of the game with some mention to (Mobile As well):
1-A nice story (not the best in the MK universe) with a cinematic experience.
2-The best fighting mechanics in an MK game so far.
3-Easy fatalities and Skip fights feature makes the game accessible even to casuals.
4-A lot of costumes which pays respect to the previous titles and a lot of new ones.
5-WB ID is awesome, you can cross-unlock stuff on mobile and PC (Also consoles) making it an on-going experience.
6-This game has the best netcode in an mk game FINALLY, but with some minor issues.
7-MIND-BLOWING graphics with alot of attention to details.
8-Blood,mud and sweat effects makes every stage you play in, a different experience.
9-Stages has a variety of environmental effects and interactables making every Stage is a unique experience.
10-Interactables are the best in the series, use them as a combo linker,ender or even starter.*throws Blanche*
11-The Krypt is fun and rewarding combining old style adventure with some terrifying moments.
12-Faction War,boss and invasion along-side the living towers gives the game more juice after you are done with story and the Krypt.
13-Fatalities and Brutalites are freaking awesome, Faction kills not that much but adds a nice flavor.
14-X-RAYS are the best in the series so far and a great follow up to mk9 X-RAYS.
15-The Frame data option offers a great insight for pro players.
16-The re-introduction of the running button is great and gives you a lot to work with if there is a spammer out and you just want to get in and punish them.
17-Block Breaker is FREAKING EPIC no more will you take bullFish from a guy who is pressuring you.
18-Characters Variations is so awesome, it allows you to feel the different characteristics of a fighter, use a hidden cursors and punish your enemies.(Pro Tip)
19-Can't wait for Tremor and other DLC characters.

9/10 ShadowOTD

reviewText:
I'll keep this brief: The game itself is fun.  There is a wealth of worthwhile single player and multiplayer content.  The mechanical changes such as interactive environments and alternate character variations add plenty to the game.  If it gets patched into a more functional state, I'll say go for it.  If.

You see, the PC version of MKX is a car wreck.  It runs poorly, with frequent frame rate drops.  The netcode is gag-inducing, and has all but pushed away much of the community of online players.  Glitches abound, including everyone's favorite, the classic save data eraser!  Yep, after 15 hours of play, I booted up the game this afternoon to find that all of my data had been wiped for no reason.  Similar reports have been popping up for weeks, with some people experiencing this glitch on multiple occasions.  Oh well.  I'll write this one off as a lesson learned, at least until (IF) High Voltage patches it up.  Until such time, don't make the same mistake I did.

5/5 Edit: So I come home from work today, cautiously excited to see if the new patch had improved the game.  LOL nope, there was no patch.  Why?  Because after being rolled out, it was pulled back because it deleted all players' save data.  All of it.  Everywhere.  Permanently, unless you had the foresight to back your stuff up.  This is the world we live in, ladies and gentlemen.  I weep for our children, and the world they will inherit from us.

reviewText:
Let's get to it.
I love Mortal Kombat.
The story is cute and feels a bit short.
The fatality shortcuts is a little sad, but it makes my nephew feel awesome.
I can't play this game with Razer headphones without some ungodly noise.
The game it nice enough, the roster isn't much, It's weird not to see some serious series staples.
the game IS pretty, functional and responsive.
Why am I downvoting?
Because I think the decision to leave the PC/Steam market out on the new DLC content characters is a poor choice
and it really influenced my opinion on if other people should get it.
NetherRealm Studios  and High Voltage Software
don't believe in this project enough to give us the same options as the console crowd, don't expect the support or online to be around past 2018.

reviewText:
Pros:
- looks pretty good when you can run it decently
- lot of single player content
- decent AI
- a somewhat interesting cinematic story mode, even if it's the same NRS has been doing since MK9

Cons:
- very badly optimized for PC - forces even good machines to disable almost everything and crank resolution down to hit the 60fps needed for online play
- stiff gameplay revolving around target combos and air juggles
- dedicated block button? in 2015? COME ON
- the game basically considers you as an idiot and changes the controls orientation in the menus depending on the direction you're facing at the moment
- everyone agrees it has horrible netcode
- developer dropped PC support, making it a dead game one year after its release

If you're searching for a nice single player abandonware fighting game then you might like it. But don't even think on spending more than 5-10 bucks on this.

reviewText:
The PC version of Mortal Kombat X is a bad version of a great game. You should play Mortal Kombat X. Don't play it on the PC.

To say the game was rough at launch is an understatement. It was varying degrees of broken for many and it took them a long time to get the game into a reasonably decent shape. Some still aren't so lucky, but it at least runs passably for most now.

Problem is, WB Games is continuing its well-known track record with PC games. Look up the Arkham Knight fiasco if you're not familiar with the respect they've been showing to the platform lately. The short version is that PC players who have loyally stuck with this lousy version of a great game are getting another slap in the face, because WB Games is ending support. The console versions are getting exciting new characters, a new stage, new costumes, and even a netcode patch that should make online play more pleasant.

PC players are getting jack.

PC support has been officially dropped. As a long time Mortal Kombat fan, this is pretty heartbreaking. Mortal Kombat X is a fantastic game and it deserves better than this. Its fans deserve better than this. The people who paid good money for a broken game only to stick with it and get abandoned by a negligent publisher deserve better than this.

If you have the ability, go buy Mortal Kombat X on a console and send an email to WB Games letting them know which version you'd rather be playing. This game deserves to be played and enjoyed, but this version, and frankly any future PC release from WB Games, is impossible to recommend. Shame on WB Games for treating its customers this poorly, and shame on NetherRealm for standing idly by as its fans get trampled on by a publisher who's dragging the good name of its series through the mud.

reviewText:
There's the game and the publisher.

The publisherVERY negative.
They abandoned this game a couple of days ago meaning they won't bother trying to fix their bad port.
This includes;
- No new content packs that are coming to consoles
- No improved netcode (multiplayer as for now is pressing a button and seeing your character move about 4 seconds afterwards).
- They ♥♥♥♥ing dropped support on this.
Basically they screwed the community and while the community is desperately trying to get their point across with petitions and demonstrating their stream, they happily ban everyone who tries to do that from their stream and already blocked the links to the petitions.

On a scale of DayZ's developers to Naughty Dogg developers; they're having a nice cuddle with DayZ.

The gameThe game seems fun so far but it has this unfair moves" issue.
There are quite some characters you'll be facing that have unblockable ranged attacks that they can just keep spamming and spamming until you're dead or a couple of hits away from death.
This ruins a lot of fights for me.

Also the button detection seems to be absolute ♥♥♥♥ for some moves
date: having about a 50% chance to detect a proper input.\n\nThe combat is a lot more strategic and planny than Tekken
recommended: but because of the lack of button presses it mostly comes down to buttonmashing simple combo's and hoping to get an X-Ray attack (long animation that takes a lot of health) to cheese away the opponent's health.\n\nMultiplayer is present but as for the dropped support by the publishers; it's awful and will not be improved
hoursPlayed: so basically don't buy this game for multiplayer. Heck
voteText:
i'd even be wary if you're going to play it against a friend who you can usually play games just fine with.

The story is pretty cheesy but the developers did a good job at getting the player immersed with long cutscenes that you could take part in at any second.
This is my first game in the Mortal Kombat series and it really does pull me into the universe.

So TL;DR:
Game's combat is fun

reviewText: I'm 33 years old. I've been playing Mortal Kombat since I was knee-high to a severed leg. I have personally requested 12 refunds, 3 tickets in the wind, 4 separate emails to WB, 2 to NRS, and numerous polite requests for comment from Boon/Lansdown's accounts. All dirty crickets.\n\nSo until they say one way or another I'm done. 23 years and I am so sad to say that I'm done. Shame on you Netherrealm and shame on Warner Brothers PC board of directors. Ya'll are ♥♥♥♥ed in the head.

reviewText:
Leading example of how shameless a developer and publisher can be.

Mortal Kombat X PC port is basicly a Batman: Arkham Knight PC version all over again, except this franchise isn't as widely popular as Batman is so Warner could sweep this fiasco under the rug.

First of all, the gameplay was relased hell broken. From unplayable online netcode to memory leak crashes (two of which the EXACT same problem was with MK9 the very same piece of **** studio ported to PC and is unfixed to this day and abandoned, just like MKX. Worth mentioning that up to relase day just like in case of Arkham Knight, it was kept a secret that Netherrealm didn't even work a single byte of the PC version), this time with bonus extras such as brutally unstable framerate even on high end PCs and graphical options that change nothing and resault in the same performance on highest and lowest settings on said high end PCs. Later on it got a little better with ~half year of patches and while the multiplayer is still unplayable on any kind of competitive level because of the netcode and constantly unstable framerate and memory leak crashes, at least the singleplayer campign is playable and very enjoyable.

Post-relase development history includes over 50Gb of patches that were always a step forward and two steps back that ultimately helped a TINY bit with the framerate issues but every other problem MKX suffered at relase is still present. WarnerBros of course denies it all and due to low sales (WHY? I WONDER WHY THIS GARBAGE HAS LOW SALES?!), so the amateur developers who previously worked mainly on mobile games before messing up MK9, aren't really given a budget to have any manpower to fix MKX, and after a year it's completely abandoned. Once they even managed to absolutely wipe everyone's profile back to absolute zero. I'm completely serious. All your saves, story progression and related unlocks, krypt unlocks, online profile, literally everything was deleted months(!) after relase. And pooof, there goes all your months of work. But they after 3 weeks of outrage, generously decided to unlock everything for everyone who was caught up in their 17Gb disaster patch, that got pulled back so we had to download another 17Gb of the old files, just so the later relased fixed patch" (patch itself is supposed to the fix for god's sake are they even developers or babies throwing dogsh-t to each other laughing?!) basicly didn't change anything. Other than killing off the entire singleplayer motivation because it unlocked everything
date: so all the extra __ACTUALLY_WORKING___ (miracle!) singleplayer game modes became entirely pointless. I don't even mention how long this whole procedure took them from start to finish (we are talking about weeks here) and it was just the story of ONE patch
recommended: from all that included and introduced less harmful but similar problems.\n\nI feel sorry for anyone who paid full price for this on relase (including myself) and extra sorry for those who were fool enough to pre-order a season pass (what you should never do by the way). While I do not intend to pay a single cent for the season pass

reviewText: I really want to like this game but a few things hold it back. Any fighting game should always be designed to run at 60 fps. The transition between fighting and x-ray moves (60 to 30 to 60 fps ) is jarring. Also, arcade controller support is poor. I have Madcatz Sf4 Sanwa stick, which works, but when I use this and a friend uses a xbox 360 controller (w/ wireless dongle), the button configuration aren't saved to individual profiles. If I save a button config to profile 1, then another config is saved to profile 2, it doesn't let us use the profiles. If I select profile 1, then player 2 selects profile 2, the game makes me use profile 2 also. Then if i switch to profile 1, it switches player 2 to profile 1. So if you use an arcade stick, I would stay away from this game. I do like it, but.......Why no PC patch since 9/2015. This game could be so good after some balances. Street Fighter gets constant updates, I see no reason MKX shouldn't get the same treatment. I don't like SF5 by the way.

reviewText:
DO NOT BUY MORTAL KOMBAT X ON PC.

Where is our XL version NRS? How could you have screwed this up so badly?

MKX is easily my favorite fighting game of all time. It has everything: classic, memorable characters, fun mechanics, it's great to watch, accessible to amateurs, lots of offline content and the most fricking amazing aesthetics I have ever seen in a fighter.

However I am a PC player through and through. I don't own a console, and I truly hope fighters will get off on this platform as well, even in a non-competetive capacity. I get the advantage of playing these kind of games on consoles, but what's wrong with casually enjoying them on a slightly sub-optimal platform? MKX was a shining example that this could have been done well, as they fixed most of the problems the original port had.

Now however the PC version got absolutely shafted. No new netcode that the consoles got, no Alien, Triborg, Boraicho or Leatherface, no any future DLC for that matter, and no XL bundle. This is simply unacceptable and I'm truly bummed about this. You had a great game going here, NRS, but you dropped the ball. You deserve all the flak that you're getting for this trainwreck.

reviewText:
I've had over 300 hours logged on MKX. I feel in my opinion its a great game, with some passionate devs, this came out just about unplayable but now its pretty good to go, atleast single player and online with friends on private matches. It runs great now as well.

However it really pains me to have a featured game on my profile lose all support for its PC platform. Kombat pack 2 was announced. No mention of changes to PC for about a couple of weeks and we only recently found out that it won't be coming via a tweet. That to me is like an Ex girlfriend dropping the relationship via a text. Its just not right for something you've spent so much time on, loving the experiences, going through the hardships of the horrible launch just to see it thrown away in the end. I feel Ed and his team at Neverealm would have this on PC if they could. I don't know for sure but its been obvious through most of last year the higher ups at Warner Bro's don't listen to a word their devs say to them nevermind the fans of their owned franchises.

This paints a picture WB are very angry with PC gaming at this moment due to the botched Arkham Knight release on steam, They do not wish to support it anymore. They thought they could get by releasing on PC with using the most cheapest Developers out there to Contract their PC ports but since they couldn't anymore and it actually required a decent investment, They've essentially pulled out of PC gaming for the forseeable future. I doubt we'll be getting Injustice 2 or anything like that. They've not given Netherealm the resources or skills to produce on PC. Ed can't just code that himself and WB are not providing for us anymore.

Pick this up on some CD Key site for 10 bucks with Kombat Pass 1. You'll not be giving them anymore money as you bought from a re-seller who already has provided WB with a cut for the key.

reviewText:
Today's Review: Mortal Kombat X

Overview and impressions: I'll start for saying, i dind't have any optimization problems at all with this game, runs complelty fluid on max settings to a constant of 60 fps, thenfore i really enjoy it the time i've played it, didn't finished the story because honestly i wasn't in this game for the story to start with, the game improves over MK9 with graphics and mechanics but it has less kombatans than the previous game, that means a little rooster of fighters to play with, it add factions which are completly useless unless you really like leaderboards and adds more modes for single and multiplayer modes, what makes me vote down this game is the recent announcement, a few days ago i saw that it was coming a second Kombat Pack that includes 5 more characters to the roaster and Warner Bros decided to abandon the pc confirming there will be no Enhaced Online Pc support or Kombat Pack 2, being said that, a publisher/developer that abandons a game does not deserve a thumbs up, furthermore i have the MKX Premium Edition so being a supporter of the franchise this is insulting for me, shame on you and shame on your greedy console eyes.

What this means to us as pc players?

- No improving netcode to online games (online multi is broken)
- No kombat pack 2 or new characters
- No new dlc maps or stages
- No future support patches or updates, ever

Do not buy this game on pc or consoles, you're supporting a company that ♥♥♥♥♥ on their loyals customers that pay for this game with their hard earned money.
voteText: 16 of 21 people (76%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Do you enjoy laggy & unresponsive inputs?
Do you enjoy blocky stiff non-fluid gameplay?
Do you enjoy unfocused character development and balance?

If you said yes to all 3 of these, then Mortal Kombat X is the game for you!

Forget everything you knew about fighting games. Footsies? Gone! Hit confirming? Gone! Just about everything that makes a fighting game good? Gone! Have fun putting your opponent in the corner or being put in the corner and just senselessly mashing buttons with no chance of escape.

Welcome to Mortal Kombat X for PC, one of the worst game ports I've ever played. Dozens of useless patches to help destroy your bandwidth limit and senselessly fill your hard drive. This game is fundamentally broken and is about as balanced as playing tug-of-war with 200 fat kids. I'd rather hit my own genitals with a hammer than play this game. Seriously I would even play Mortal Kombat Special Forces over this game.

Awful port aside the game just isn't good. I don't know what the hell NetherRealm Studios was trying to do with this game, but I think they failed. Now you may be thinking But this game is new
recommended: well I can tell you right now
hoursPlayed: no amount of patching will make this game any better. It's an absolute joke of an addition to the fighting game genre. It lacks the mechanics that generally make a game good. As a long time fan of the MK series it saddens me that this game is probably the worst new game I've played in the last 2 to 3 years. I don't understand how they went from MK9 to this one.\n\nWhy do they keep hiring High Voltage Software to do their ports
voteText: this company is garbage at what they do. Their ports of MK9 and Injustice for PC were plagued by the same issues and they're still not fixed. It must be really awesome to do shoddy half-cocked work and still get paid for it. Where can I sign up

2/10 would not bang.

reviewText: Don't buy this game! If you really feel like it's up your alley, buy the XL edition for one of the consoles; if that's not an option, I advise you to steer clear of this mess.\n\nWhile compared to Mortal Kombat 9, the game has made significant progress in terms of character design and just general maturity (if I can even use that word describing a game with goofy, over the top fatalities), both Netherrealm and WB managed to prove once again that they have difficulties putting out proper products for the PC. After a very poor, bug ridden launch, MK X did receive fixes and started to finally shape up, but then was suddenly abandoned, along with the roughly 500,000 players who purchased the PC version; as the PC version will not only not receive the newest DLC fighters, MK XL will also not launch on the platform. This incompetency and abandonment of a platform (which feels like a childish, hysterical reaction to a non-working product not producing great sales, but instead receiving negative reviews) should be a warning to keep in mind with future NR / WB games.

reviewText:
MORTAL KOMBAT X:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

I purchased this game simply due to the amazing graphics I saw on the trailer. To be honest with you, I am not a real fan of this type of game. I do own a couple of titles (including Mortal Kombat 9) but rarely play them.

What impressed me on my first attempt was how easy the controls (moves) were to master which to me was a massive plus. From this, I jumped into the story mode and was just blown away by this game, from the cinematic scenes to the game play!

At first, you will have to choose one of five factions to join (you will have challenges to achieve on a daily basis to help your faction ranking). After choosing one faction, you will be directed to the game menu where you will be able to select a mode of play.  You will have several options: one player, two players and online mode.

Each fight you win, you will get coins (this will vary upon successful combos) which you will be able to use in the Krypt section to unlock plenty of gizmos by opening tombs. My suggestion to you is to amalgamate as many coins as possible because the krypt is fairly big and has many tombs to ravage.

Mortal Kombat X has absolutely splendid graphics, runs smoothly and the controls are easy to master.

Positives:
~~~~~~~~

-	Splendid cinematic scenes (story mode)
-	Great control system
-	Very addictive
-	 Plenty of achievements
-	Trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~

-	Big download but well worth it

Fun, addictive, visually grandiose, just a cracker of a fighting game!

10/10

FOLLOW THE CPT FROGGY CURATOR PAGE HERE

reviewText:
(Edit: 6/20/2015)

Im a big fan of the MK saga, this game has everything we have been waiting for, but others things we didnt spect too... here is my review:

CONS:

100% CPU usage.
Menu Freezes and crashes the game.
Menu, cinematics and x-rays are capped to 30fps.
Day 1 DLC and things that could be in the game but they decide to sell it.
Lag and stuttering in the story mode and in the online mode.
The online works whenever he wants to.
Only 13 stages, when in MK9 where close to 20.
Some classic characters are missing such as, smoke, rain, cyrax, sektor, noob saibot. (I bet they are going to sell them).
Dont forget the 30 gb Jason patch.
Constant money grabbing of the costumers.

PROS:
Amazing graphics and animations.
Character design and stage design.
Fluid and consistent fighting and fatalities.
Nice menues.
Faction battles is a good idea.
The DLC content is pretty good.
Game optimization.

Final Score: 7,5. A game with a lot of potential wasted by only thinking in costumers money instead of a good experience, thats why my negative recommendation.

reviewText:
I would never recommend this game, even to someone I didn't like.

The problems start with the utter laziness that went into porting this game to the PC.  There is no excuse for poor optimization,  poor hardware support, and the poor netcode for this game.   This game wasn't ported by some unknown company using some unknown engine.  This game was ported by High Voltage Software ,a veteran in the world of video games, on the unreal engine, one of the most flexible game engines ever made.  It is unconscionable that people who exceed the recomended requirements for this game still have trouble running it after all this time.

Even getting past the technical issues the story itself has a lot of issues.  The most glaring of which is the way the younger generation is portrayed.  They are all arrogant self centered tough talking paper tigers who achieve their goals not through hard work and preparedness but simply because they want to real hard.  The new bad guys" that are introduced are far more likable than the aforementioned paper tiger protagonists.

Even a mediocre story can be forgiven if the game play is good enough.  Sadly that is not the case here.  There are two major problems with the game play (three if you are an avid online player).

The first problem is the execution of the variations system.  A character's special moves are divided up by variation.  So no matter which variation you pick you always are playing as an incomplete version of that character.  I do think that the idea of variations is good because it adds a tactical element to your choice in play style.  Variations should be made by buffing certain moves not by buffing some and taking other moves away.

The second major game play issue is the fighting itself.  When the game first came out the fighting was ok.  It allowed multiple playing styles where the outcome of the fight was not decided superior style but by the player's own skill in using their respective styles.  The fighting aspect of the game has been slowly eroded to favor one particular style of play.  This has happened because the developers gave into the many complaints with incorrectly and overly used terms like balance
voteText: and spam.  So instead of fixing major technical issues and glitches we got nerfed characters.\n\nThe third problem is the netcode.  For someone with my playstlye and skill level the netcode is only minor annoyance but for someone who uses the "Footsy EVO" style of game play
helpfulPercent: who have invested a lot of time into this game
votesHelpful: the sudden frame drops  would be devastating.\n\nThe most tragic thing about this game is that despite all of it's short comings Mortal Kombat  X is still a good game.   Even if  like me you are irritated by all of things I mentioned above you can still have fun playing the many different game modes and unlocking collectibles.  Now WB games and NetherRealm studios have decided to no longer support the PC platform.  This means no more bug fixes and the future DLC and additional content has been canceled.  This is another in a long list of unintelligent and dishonorable decisions by WB games.  I urge you to not only not purchase this game
votesTotal: but not to purchase anything attached to WB games.  This is going to be hard but if you support WB games you are supporting  the idea that Publishers and developers can make this unfinished crap
commentsCount: and people will buy it anyway.  If WB games and NetherRealm studios ever stops pouting
column16: puts their big boy pants on
column17: owns up to and fixes their mistakes I would be glad to support them again.  In the event that hell freezes over and they actually do then I will edit this review and admit I was wrong.\n\n"

reviewText:

The PC version will not receive Kombat Pack 2 or improved netcode, nor will there be a PC version of Mortal Kombat XL.

Between this and Arkham Knight, I see no reason to support NRS or WB Games in the future.

The problems start with the utter laziness that went into porting this game to the PC.  There is no excuse for poor optimization,  poor hardware support, and the poor netcode for this game.   This game wasn't ported by some unknown company using some unknown engine.  This game was ported by High Voltage Software ,a veteran in the world of video games, on the unreal engine, one of the most flexible game engines ever made.  It is unconscionable that people who exceed the recomended requirements for this game still have trouble running it after all this time.

Even getting past the technical issues the story itself has a lot of issues.  The most glaring of which is the way the younger generation is portrayed.  They are all arrogant self centered tough talking paper tigers who achieve their goals not through hard work and preparedness but simply because they want to real hard.  The new bad guys" that are introduced are far more likable than the aforementioned paper tiger protagonists.

Even a mediocre story can be forgiven if the game play is good enough.  Sadly that is not the case here.  There are two major problems with the game play (three if you are an avid online player).

The first problem is the execution of the variations system.  A character's special moves are divided up by variation.  So no matter which variation you pick you always are playing as an incomplete version of that character.  I do think that the idea of variations is good because it adds a tactical element to your choice in play style.  Variations should be made by buffing certain moves not by buffing some and taking other moves away.

The second major game play issue is the fighting itself.  When the game first came out the fighting was ok.  It allowed multiple playing styles where the outcome of the fight was not decided superior style but by the player's own skill in using their respective styles.  The fighting aspect of the game has been slowly eroded to favor one particular style of play.  This has happened because the developers gave into the many complaints with incorrectly and overly used terms like balance
voteText: and spam.  So instead of fixing major technical issues and glitches we got nerfed characters.\n\nThe third problem is the netcode.  For someone with my playstlye and skill level the netcode is only minor annoyance but for someone who uses the "Footsy EVO" style of game play
helpfulPercent: who have invested a lot of time into this game
votesHelpful: the sudden frame drops  would be devastating.\n\nThe most tragic thing about this game is that despite all of it's short comings Mortal Kombat  X is still a good game.   Even if  like me you are irritated by all of things I mentioned above you can still have fun playing the many different game modes and unlocking collectibles.  Now WB games and NetherRealm studios have decided to no longer support the PC platform.  This means no more bug fixes and the future DLC and additional content has been canceled.  This is another in a long list of unintelligent and dishonorable decisions by WB games.  I urge you to not only not purchase this game
votesTotal: but not to purchase anything attached to WB games.  This is going to be hard but if you support WB games you are supporting  the idea that Publishers and developers can make this unfinished crap
commentsCount: and people will buy it anyway.  If WB games and NetherRealm studios ever stops pouting
column16: puts their big boy pants on
column17: owns up to and fixes their mistakes I would be glad to support them again.  In the event that hell freezes over and they actually do then I will edit this review and admit I was wrong.\n\n"

reviewText:
Ladies and gentlemen, I'm a long-time fan and this IS the most disappointing MK/fighting game.

GOOD:
Graphics Krypt - It's good but the graphics makes the game REALLY bad and wastes space for the entire game. There are still jumpscares though. Addictively fun Minigames Beautiful soundtracksMore fatalities/BrutalitiesFighter selection perfected!! 10/10 - What amazes me about this is that each characters have unique animations and thats good!
[/h1]Variations! 10/10[/h1]
Fighters' conversations/intros - THIS is what a true fighting game must be! It's impossible that all characters have intros and outros! It's really really good feature and MUST be in every fighting game! It just have to be!
BAD:
New characters are horrible - They're disgusting. Why don't you just add the characters from the previous MK games?? That idea would be much better than having those teen titan pieces of ♥♥♥♥. They've also killed the iconic original kombatants. We have this Ferra/Torr, Erron Black and Kotal Kahn. Why are they on MK??? Why do we need such characters like this instead of the MK theme style? If I were you I'd just add characters from previous MK games...
FPS low - MK9 rans in a flash, but just 4 years later this piece of ♥♥♥♥ rans about 10-15.
Character designs - What the ♥♥♥♥ happened to Ermac's body, Mileena's disgusting mouth, topless junkie ♥♥♥♥♥ Shinnok & Quan Chi? Back in time when playing MK4, it was the really a nightmare horror. Even Shinnok & Quan Chi were scary and their brutal fatalities that I can't play the game alone. I admit it, I hate all the characters' designs, just LOOK AT THEM!
Bad PC port -Microtransactions - Is it just me or the developers begin to grow to EA? Of all previous games, Goro is now a DLC character??
Unrealistic fatalities - Jax The Ribber, Selfie, etc
Guest characters - Why? Just why? After Freddy Krueger was released in MK9 I really hoped they won't do this mistake ever again. Oh they did, along with Jason, Predator and that chainsaw guy.
No stage fatalitiesNo new characters - I WANT MY ♥♥♥♥IGN TRIBORG! I always love robots since when I was a kid! My mouth died of watering down of Triborg's appearence on consoles but not PC!
WB Games -Lack of stages- The amount of content, DLCs & microtransactions added and the price, I'd say 13 arenas are really, really not enough. MK9 has a whopping 26 arenas!
Shadowy game design concept - Before this game came out, MKX is EXACTLY what I thought it to be. ♥♥♥♥ing shadow everywhere. You know what I mean? Everything's so shadowy, even wallpapers, not colorful and beautiful like from MK9.
Bad story mode - I just don't like it. At all.
No returning features - There is still no kreate your fighter, kreate fatality, or mini games from Injustice (because QTE ♥♥♥♥ing sucks a@@)
MK XL - Not enough whoring for money huh? It pretends to be 'complete pack' but actually you have to pre-order it again to get more costumes.
Companion app- It destroyed my productivity just to get Injustice Scorpion skin, during the process it looked like I've wasted my life to get the skin because they've stopped support MK. Meanwhile, they just want more money. Each new character card cost $19.99
PC support - As of January 16, developers officially stated that there will be no support for this game & no KP2 for the PC version. Why? Why? This doesn't make sense! I've been waiting for this forever and it's broke my heart. And why the ♥♥♥♥ did it take so much time for 4 characters to work?  Complete game is 40.3 GB - Are you kidding me? 40 gigabyte is almost GTA V size, and the game even lacks of arenas! Just a fighting game, facing one's opponent, not open world... It would be a great idea if you add a downloadable option 'Krypt' because of its unnecesary graphics and laggy FPS.

F.Y.I: I watched a little bit of MKX instead of buying it, but then later bought it. This is what I expected for this piece of ♥♥♥♥. I prefer MK9. I don't know what they're onto but they've turned from tiny trustful company to EA. Greedier than ever. I want to add the worst and disappointing support ever of 21st century. The same of what PAYDAY 2 developers did to us. Treating us like terrorists. I'm disappointed as ♥♥♥♥ing hell, Ed.
Don't be an idiot by the way, if you want to be smart, just buy MK9. It has good story mode, graphics, larger roster and colorful instead of just shadow I mentioned before.
MK9 FTW

4.8/10
FATALITY

reviewText:
Before I get enthralled with the overwhelming negatives of the game let me first mention the things that the game does RIGHT.

- Great visuals, decent storyline for a fighting game
- Cleaner, crisper HUD than MK9
- Great controller support (no big settings to be changed)
- Fluid mechanics in situations with no lag

Now, let me touch on a few of the negatives that I've noticed so far. These few negatives actually made me stop playing the game for a decent amount of time due to sheer frustration.

- Terrible online matchmaking capabilities for PC
- Constantly paired against opponents with high ping
- The game doesn't integrate a feature to explain mechanics to new players (this isn't a negative for myself, but for many...)
- Overwhelming lack of bug fixes/connection issues

The inability to play multiplayer fluidly is definitely what turned me off of this game. If you are thinking of purchasing this game for a dynamic multiplayer experience, purchase something else because this will be a huge waste of time and money for you, and it sure was for me.

reviewText:
So it's pretty well known the launch for this game was a disaster.

Let's look at the game a week later.

A little background, i've been a fan of MK for 20 years. I started with MK2 back when i was 7 years old. I grew up with MK. This game isn't the worst MK, seeing as we have abominations like armageddon and MK Gold in our past, but it's certianly a huge waste from a team i know can do better.

Commands still randomly drop, you'll not perform a combo because that game sometimes doesn't feel like it. Fighting otherwise feels pretty meh. It's more like injustice than MK9 to be quite honest and i don't consider that to be a good thing.

The unlock system is totally and completely busted. The Krypt is now a maze with jumpscare QTEs and multiple branching paths. So what used to be a simple task is now a chore.

The story mode is back, and the story is in a word: Boring.  It tells of shinnok's return, but from the perspective of a bunch of newbies no one cares about and are presented as unlikably as possible, or from Johnny and Sonya's perspective. Everyone cool is a quan chi wraith.

There's multiple unplayable fighters in the game, such as Rain, Tanya(!) Sindel, This presents the game as a bad value. An unfinished Starter pack" of a game you have to pay to unlock at a later date. I don't know about you

reviewText:
First review ever.

Game itself? Amazing game. But this port to PC is just beyond horrific and the launch of this game was beyond terrible. Don't get me wrong. I would buy this game a thousand times over...for consoles that is.

First off, the port to PC...Even with grand specs, my computer can not run it without some hiccups. The best I can do is run it on 800x600 resolution with low quality, which gives me a steady fps. The x-rays are 30 fps, which i don't mind. What I do mind is suddenly when you do an x-ray, you notice that visual drop in fps.

Now, the launch of this game on April 14...I was one of the ones that pre-ordered the game in hopes of it being a superior port to its predecessor (MK9). I pre-loaded the ~3 GB game" and it asked me to download 29 DLC packages/patches. I looked at their explanation and it said you can play the game as it downloads
date: but do the developers not know that you can't download while in a game on steam? Of course they do. My guess is that
recommended: really the developers were not ready for a full release of the PC port on April 14.\n\nSlyly disguising an incomplete port in the form of DLC patches
hoursPlayed: they managed to sneak in the fact that DLC patches #5 and #9 were oddly missing from the full package on release day. And of course major features were missing such as story mode
voteText: faction mode
helpfulPercent: and general online play on release day. Furthermore is the fact that on April 18
votesHelpful: a 15 GB "Patch" was uploaded. A 15 GB "patch"? You might as well call that half of the game. I rest my case that this game was never ready on release day and was never meant to be released before it was ready. Even with the 15 GB patch
votesTotal: there are features missing. The netcode is still horrible. People lag out of online matches
votesFunny: especially King of the Hill.\n\nI understand turning this into a PC port is a quick buck
commentsCount: and hell you got my money. Even for the DLC

column18: I understand you're work-for-hire developers

reviewText:
Alright, time to edit ye old review. The first time I did this, I was pretty upset. The game had a disasterous launch on PC if anyone remembers. Since then, some time has passed and, more importantly, some critical patches have come out. Here goes...

First off, I am a fan of the MK series, been playing em since MK3. I think that MKX is a pretty good fighting game. The characters and variations are diverse and interesting. The game, in my opinion, is balanced well. The graphics are great especially in regards to character models and backgrounds. The fighting is fluid and has good animations. The story is serviceable. Its no Mass Effect, but I found it interesting(minus the stupid QTE). People who haven't played MK before should have no trouble understanding whats going on. Besides the story, you got stuff like klassic towers, test your might, etc. The Krypt also makes a comeback if you are into that kinda thing. They made it sorta like a minigame which I found to be ♥♥♥♥ing annoying. You have to run around and solve little puzzles to unlock regions with chests. Summing up, I would give this game an 8/10.

So why do I not recommend it then? ONLINE MULTIPLAYER. Yes ladies and gentlemen, even after all the ♥♥♥♥♥ing and the patching, it still doesn't work properly. The lag simply makes online play impossible. This isn't some 3-5 frame lag like in USF4, your character behaves as if he/she injected 100cc of morphine and is struggling to stay awake. Simple combos that I can pull off with my eyes closed in practice cannot be performed online due to the lag. Multiplayer is such an important thing to get right in a fighting game. If you look at my time played"
date: 90% of that time I spent in practice/story/towers. The other 10% I was trying my best to play online. This usually defaulted to: play a couple of matches
hoursPlayed: toss my controller across the room and turn the ♥♥♥♥ing game off. Matches are starting to take longer and longer to find. The rooms are pretty much empty most of the time except for Brazil for some reason.\n\nSo basically
voteText: unless you want to play against the computer
helpfulPercent: don't buy this game. As for me
votesHelpful: its a little late to get a refund xD. I'm definately not buying anything from Neatherealm on PC again though and same thing goes for those ♥♥♥♥ers at High Voltage."

reviewText:
I pre-ordered the game along with the kombat pack and have had a blast on it, despite all its initial problems and the fact it wiped my save file completely twice I stood by the game and slugged on through, I broke bones, took heads clean off and even TK'd Goro's guts out through his nose, it was awesome.

Imagine my delight when browsing Youtube last week as I see another kombat pack is coming and there's a Xenomorph in it, yes a bloody XENOMORPH! Sure there's 3 other characters in the pack but screw them, I wanna rip the predator apart with an Alien, it will be utterly glorious and I'm already heading to my steam wallet to get my £30 ready to pre-order the pack.

Imagine then if you will be sheer gut wrenching disapoitment I then feel when I happen across the discussion page and find out that the second pack won't be coming to PC, as well as no further balance patches or any support what so ever for that matter. No I thought, someone has it wrong, its a trick or an early April fools prank but no, a quick browse on Google confirmed that WB and NRS have abandoned us PC users and are instead only concentrating on the console versions.

You see, for as good as the game is, and it really is, everytime they update or patch it in any way they always seem to break something else, save files disapearing into the Netherealm (pun intended), buggy online, krypt crashes  or glitches galore so I can only assume they that this time they thought 'screw it, it's just about playable as it is, why break it yet again and go through the whole umpteen patches a month m'larky until we get it half right'

Now don't get me wrong, the game is really good, its a solid fighter with some great mechanics, characters and really brutal finishing moves, its a fantastic addition to MK series but I just condone us PC users getting screwed over yet again. I still have a somewhat bitter taste in my mouth from the bugfest that was Batman Arkham Knight (another WB game) and just when you start getting around the idea of forgiving them they pull a stunt like this, its just not on. I've paid my dues (about £70 worth of dues) so why should I have to miss out on extra content consoles are getting because the devs are too lazy and too incompetent to get it right, its DOA Last Round all over again, another great fighter ruined by the crappy porting standards we seem to suffer alately.

The only way we will get our voices heard is through our wallets, my advice is don't buy this game, these crooked developers will only learn if we stop giving them money for their half as*ed work, maybe one day we'll get a working product day one that won't be later abandoned due to laziness.

Street Fighter V is only around the corner now and its looking more and more possible each day that Namco are going to give us Tekken 7 on PC this year too, combine that with the other great fighters that are already out on Steam and you won't be missing much if you pass this one up, we didn't spend all this money on our rigs to be treat like second class citizens.

reviewText:
Pros:
- Gorgeous visuals, though it's a performance hog.
- Fun, fluid fighting mechanics. Easy to play, hard to master.
- Quite a bit of content if you include online..

Cons:
- Online is still not where it needs to be. (Netcode is still crap)
- Some crashing and ridiculous stutter randomly on a certain map
- WB and NR Studios have abandoned it!

I purchased the game on day one, after going to a pre-launch Launch Tournament and playing it first-hand. The game was fun and seemed to even beat MK9. I even bought the Kombat Pack.. But that was local-play on a PS4. When I tried playing it on my PC.. Well..

The original download was botched horribly. I had to re-download it multiple times because of the delivery system it used not working properly. After that, my Goro pre-order bonus mysteriously disappeared and I had to purchase it separately! Then, as expected with multiplayer games these days I guess, the netcode was a joke. Online connection was constantly iffy, and most of the time either crashed or put you in a match with slide-show style lag.

Fast-forward to present-day.. The netcode still doesn't work as it should, and the developer and publisher have decided to abandon the PC port altogether. Once again, a genuinely fun game has been ruined by either laziness or straight up shady business practices. Not to mention the $30 Kombat Pack including only a few characters and minor things.. It's ridiculous.

Do not purchase at full-price, and for that matter, do not purchase on PC. WB seems incapable of LETTING A GAME FINISH DEVELOPMENT BEFORE LAUNCH.

reviewText:
Well, this is pretty obvious. How could I recommend a game that is abandoned?

To be fair though - I don't think I ever spent more time on a game other then MKX.
Not even bugs, delayed balance patches and online lags could draw me away...
I get it, third party port, time constrains - it is understandable.
And it's a fighting game after all. There's no way to avoid suffering lol.

BTW September patches were AWESOME and fixed most of issues I had, not to mention crucial balance adjustements.

So... You go online, most populated room, find a guy you have absolutely no chance to win and send a challenge.
Get destroyed until your nemesis ragequits out of boredom.
Then you go hit the lab, reconcile what have just happened and think how to get better.
Not only learning big damage combos, but also tricky setups, defensive options, frame data, matchup studies, etc.

This is how I spent most of my time in-game.
That does not include watching pro matches and lurking the hell out of testyourmight forum.

And what happend next?
After wall and walls of TYM locals asking to clarify MKX future on Steam - NRS representative just writes a tiny little post that it won't be updated with KP2 and GGPO-like netcode.
As you can see - people got really ♥♥♥♥♥♥ by that move!

reviewText:
As a big fan of Mortal Kombat, it pains me to say that if you want to play a fighting game on PC, you're better off with waiting for Street Fighter V, or playing Guilty Gear, since those games and their developers actually support the PC community.
After the horrid launches that WB games has had both with MK X and the new Batman, it would seem they are trying to distance themselves alltogether from the PC community by not releasing an updated version of MK X for the PC.

This means simply no new netcode, characters, or levels, and only folks who play on console will get these upgrades.

You're better off spending your money elsewhere.

reviewText:
I only bought this game a few months ago, along with all DLC - and now they very quietly announced that they're dropping support for it on PC, so no new DLC, no code fixes, possibly no more online play.

The game is AAA and less than a year old, not to mention the time it took to fix all the bugs from porting it from console to PC in the first place.

This move is absolutely outrageous and highlights an issue that Steam should put in place to protect consumers from business decisions like this in the future.

reviewText:
I honestly loved this game, it was a ton of fun for me. I couldn't play online because the lag was so bad, and even though the lack of service, the crashes and the non-releases to PC hurt, I still generally had a positive experience.

I used to watch my friends on consoles get releases ahead of me, a paying customer, and now, when my concerns about the lag are finally being fixed, I head over the beta webside and only find 'PS4' and 'Xbox 1'. And that crushed me.

PC has been abandoned by Netherrealm, and so I'm abandoning them. This shouldn't be hard, but they're neglecting to even release DLC here anymore.

Caveat Emptor. (Buyer beware)
